content: 1 The LORD called to Moses and spoke to him from the Tent of Meeting, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD called to Moses and spoke to him from the Tent of Meeting, saying:

content: 2 Speak to the Israelite people, and say to them: When any of you presents an offering of cattle to the LORD, he shall choose his offering from the herd or from the flock.
content_old: 2 Speak to the Israelite people, and say to them: When any of you presents an offering of cattle to the LORD, he shall choose his offering from the herd or from the flock.

content: 3 If his offering is a burnt offering from the herd, he shall make his offering a male without blemish. He shall bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, for acceptance in his behalf before the LORD.
content_old: 3 If his offering is a burnt offering from the herd, he shall make his offering a male without blemish. He shall bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, for acceptance in his behalf before the LORD.

content: 4 He shall lay his hand upon the head of the burnt offering, that it may be acceptable in his behalf, in expiation for him.
content_old: 4 He shall lay his hand upon the head of the burnt offering, that it may be acceptable in his behalf, in expiation for him.

content: 5 The bull shall be slaughtered before the LORD; and Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall offer the blood, dashing the blood against all sides of the altar which is at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 5 The bull shall be slaughtered before the LORD; and Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall offer the blood, dashing the blood against all sides of the altar which is at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

content: 6 The burnt offering shall be flayed and cut up into sections.
content_old: 6 The burnt offering shall be flayed and cut up into sections.

content: 7 The sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire on the altar and lay out wood upon the fire;
content_old: 7 The sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire on the altar and lay out wood upon the fire;

content: 8 and Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall lay out the sections, with the head and the suet, on the wood that is on the fire upon the altar.
content_old: 8 and Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall lay out the sections, with the head and the suet, on the wood that is on the fire upon the altar.

content: 9 Its entrails and legs shall be washed with water, and the priest shall turn the whole into smoke on the altar as a burnt offering, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD.
content_old: 9 Its entrails and legs shall be washed with water, and the priest shall turn the whole into smoke on the altar as a burnt offering, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD.

content: 10 If his offering for a burnt offering is from the flock, of sheep or of goats, he shall make his offering a male without blemish.
content_old: 10 If his offering for a burnt offering is from the flock, of sheep or of goats, he shall make his offering a male without blemish.

content: 11 It shall be slaughtered before the LORD on the north side of the altar, and Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall dash its blood against all sides of the altar.
content_old: 11 It shall be slaughtered before the LORD on the north side of the altar, and Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall dash its blood against all sides of the altar.

content: 12 When it has been cut up into sections, the priest shall lay them out, with the head and the suet, on the wood that is on the fire upon the altar.
content_old: 12 When it has been cut up into sections, the priest shall lay them out, with the head and the suet, on the wood that is on the fire upon the altar.

content: 13 The entrails and the legs shall be washed with water; the priest shall offer up and turn the whole into smoke on the altar. It is a burnt offering, an offering by fire, of pleasing odor to the LORD.
content_old: 13 The entrails and the legs shall be washed with water; the priest shall offer up and turn the whole into smoke on the altar. It is a burnt offering, an offering by fire, of pleasing odor to the LORD.

content: 14 If his offering to the LORD is a burnt offering of birds, he shall choose his offering from turtledoves or pigeons.
content_old: 14 If his offering to the LORD is a burnt offering of birds, he shall choose his offering from turtledoves or pigeons.

content: 15 The priest shall bring it to the altar, pinch off its head, and turn it into smoke on the altar; and its blood shall be drained out against the side of the altar.
content_old: 15 The priest shall bring it to the altar, pinch off its head, and turn it into smoke on the altar; and its blood shall be drained out against the side of the altar.

content: 16 He shall remove its crop with its contents, and cast it into the place of the ashes, at the east side of the altar.
content_old: 16 He shall remove its crop with its contents, and cast it into the place of the ashes, at the east side of the altar.

content: 1 When a person presents an offering of meal to the LORD, his offering shall be of choice flour; he shall pour oil upon it, lay frankincense on it,
content_old: 1 When a person presents an offering of meal to the LORD, his offering shall be of choice flour; he shall pour oil upon it, lay frankincense on it,

content: 2 and present it to Aaron’s sons, the priests. The priest shall scoop out of it a handful of its choice flour and oil, as well as all of its frankincense; and this token portion he shall turn into smoke on the altar, as an offering by fire, of pleasing odor to the LORD.
content_old: 2 and present it to Aaron’s sons, the priests. The priest shall scoop out of it a handful of its choice flour and oil, as well as all of its frankincense; and this token portion he shall turn into smoke on the altar, as an offering by fire, of pleasing odor to the LORD.

content: 3 And the remainder of the meal offering shall be for Aaron and his sons, a most holy portion from the LORD’s offerings by fire.
content_old: 3 And the remainder of the meal offering shall be for Aaron and his sons, a most holy portion from the LORD’s offerings by fire.

content: 4 When you present an offering of meal baked in the oven, it shall be of choice flour: unleavened cakes with oil mixed in, or unleavened wafers spread with oil.
content_old: 4 When you present an offering of meal baked in the oven, it shall be of choice flour: unleavened cakes with oil mixed in, or unleavened wafers spread with oil.

content: 5 If your offering is a meal offering on a griddle, it shall be of choice flour with oil mixed in, unleavened.
content_old: 5 If your offering is a meal offering on a griddle, it shall be of choice flour with oil mixed in, unleavened.

content: 6 Break it into bits and pour oil on it; it is a meal offering.
content_old: 6 Break it into bits and pour oil on it; it is a meal offering.

content: 7 If your offering is a meal offering in a pan, it shall be made of choice flour in oil.
content_old: 7 If your offering is a meal offering in a pan, it shall be made of choice flour in oil.

content: 8 When you present to the LORD a meal offering that is made in any of these ways, it shall be brought to the priest who shall take it up to the altar.
content_old: 8 When you present to the LORD a meal offering that is made in any of these ways, it shall be brought to the priest who shall take it up to the altar.

content: 9 The priest shall remove the token portion from the meal offering and turn it into smoke on the altar as an offering by fire, of pleasing odor to the LORD.
content_old: 9 The priest shall remove the token portion from the meal offering and turn it into smoke on the altar as an offering by fire, of pleasing odor to the LORD.

content: 10 And the remainder of the meal offering shall be for Aaron and his sons, a most holy portion from the LORD’s offerings by fire.
content_old: 10 And the remainder of the meal offering shall be for Aaron and his sons, a most holy portion from the LORD’s offerings by fire.

content: 11 No meal offering that you offer to the LORD shall be made with leaven, for no leaven or honey may be turned into smoke as an offering by fire to the LORD.
content_old: 11 No meal offering that you offer to the LORD shall be made with leaven, for no leaven or honey may be turned into smoke as an offering by fire to the LORD.

content: 12 You may bring them to the LORD as an offering of choice products; but they shall not be offered up on the altar for a pleasing odor.
content_old: 12 You may bring them to the LORD as an offering of choice products; but they shall not be offered up on the altar for a pleasing odor.

content: 13 You shall season your every offering of meal with salt; you shall not omit from your meal offering the salt of your covenant with God; with all your offerings you must offer salt.
content_old: 13 You shall season your every offering of meal with salt; you shall not omit from your meal offering the salt of your covenant with God; with all your offerings you must offer salt.

content: 14 If you bring a meal offering of first fruits to the LORD, you shall bring new ears parched with fire, grits of the fresh grain, as your meal offering of first fruits.
content_old: 14 If you bring a meal offering of first fruits to the LORD, you shall bring new ears parched with fire, grits of the fresh grain, as your meal offering of first fruits.

content: 15 You shall add oil to it and lay frankincense on it; it is a meal offering.
content_old: 15 You shall add oil to it and lay frankincense on it; it is a meal offering.

content: 1 If his offering is a sacrifice of well-being— If he offers of the herd, whether a male or a female, he shall bring before the LORD one without blemish.
content_old: 1 If his offering is a sacrifice of well-being— If he offers of the herd, whether a male or a female, he shall bring before the LORD one without blemish.

content: 2 He shall lay his hand upon the head of his offering and slaughter it at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting; and Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall dash the blood against all sides of the altar.
content_old: 2 He shall lay his hand upon the head of his offering and slaughter it at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting; and Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall dash the blood against all sides of the altar.

content: 3 He shall then present from the sacrifice of well-being, as an offering by fire to the LORD, the fat that covers the entrails and all the fat that is about the entrails;
content_old: 3 He shall then present from the sacrifice of well-being, as an offering by fire to the LORD, the fat that covers the entrails and all the fat that is about the entrails;

content: 4 the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, that is at the loins; and the protuberance on the liver, which he shall remove with the kidneys.
content_old: 4 the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, that is at the loins; and the protuberance on the liver, which he shall remove with the kidneys.

content: 5 Aaron’s sons shall turn these into smoke on the altar, with the burnt offering which is upon the wood that is on the fire, as an offering by fire, of pleasing odor to the LORD.
content_old: 5 Aaron’s sons shall turn these into smoke on the altar, with the burnt offering which is upon the wood that is on the fire, as an offering by fire, of pleasing odor to the LORD.

content: 6 And if his offering for a sacrifice of well-being to the LORD is from the flock, whether a male or a female, he shall offer one without blemish.
content_old: 6 And if his offering for a sacrifice of well-being to the LORD is from the flock, whether a male or a female, he shall offer one without blemish.

content: 7 If he presents a sheep as his offering, he shall bring it before the LORD
content_old: 7 If he presents a sheep as his offering, he shall bring it before the LORD

content: 8 and lay his hand upon the head of his offering. It shall be slaughtered before the Tent of Meeting, and Aaron’s sons shall dash its blood against all sides of the altar.
content_old: 8 and lay his hand upon the head of his offering. It shall be slaughtered before the Tent of Meeting, and Aaron’s sons shall dash its blood against all sides of the altar.

content: 9 He shall then present, as an offering by fire to the LORD, the fat from the sacrifice of well-being: the whole broad tail, which shall be removed close to the backbone; the fat that covers the entrails and all the fat that is about the entrails;
content_old: 9 He shall then present, as an offering by fire to the LORD, the fat from the sacrifice of well-being: the whole broad tail, which shall be removed close to the backbone; the fat that covers the entrails and all the fat that is about the entrails;

content: 10 the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, that is at the loins; and the protuberance on the liver, which he shall remove with the kidneys.
content_old: 10 the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, that is at the loins; and the protuberance on the liver, which he shall remove with the kidneys.

content: 11 The priest shall turn these into smoke on the altar as food, an offering by fire to the LORD.
content_old: 11 The priest shall turn these into smoke on the altar as food, an offering by fire to the LORD.

content: 12 And if his offering is a goat, he shall bring it before the LORD
content_old: 12 And if his offering is a goat, he shall bring it before the LORD

content: 13 and lay his hand upon its head. It shall be slaughtered before the Tent of Meeting, and Aaron’s sons shall dash its blood against all sides of the altar.
content_old: 13 and lay his hand upon its head. It shall be slaughtered before the Tent of Meeting, and Aaron’s sons shall dash its blood against all sides of the altar.

content: 14 He shall then present as his offering from it, as an offering by fire to the LORD, the fat that covers the entrails and all the fat that is about the entrails;
content_old: 14 He shall then present as his offering from it, as an offering by fire to the LORD, the fat that covers the entrails and all the fat that is about the entrails;

content: 15 the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, that is at the loins; and the protuberance on the liver, which he shall remove with the kidneys.
content_old: 15 the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, that is at the loins; and the protuberance on the liver, which he shall remove with the kidneys.

content: 16 The priest shall turn these into smoke on the altar as food, an offering by fire, of pleasing odor. All fat is the LORD’s.
content_old: 16 The priest shall turn these into smoke on the altar as food, an offering by fire, of pleasing odor. All fat is the LORD’s.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 Speak to the Israelite people thus: When a person unwittingly incurs guilt in regard to any of the LORD’s commandments about things not to be done, and does one of them—
content_old: 2 Speak to the Israelite people thus: When a person unwittingly incurs guilt in regard to any of the LORD’s commandments about things not to be done, and does one of them—

content: 3 If it is the anointed priest who has incurred guilt, so that blame falls upon the people, he shall offer for the sin of which he is guilty a bull of the herd without blemish as a sin offering to the LORD.
content_old: 3 If it is the anointed priest who has incurred guilt, so that blame falls upon the people, he shall offer for the sin of which he is guilty a bull of the herd without blemish as a sin offering to the LORD.

content: 4 He shall bring the bull to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, before the Lord, and lay his hand upon the head of the bull. The bull shall be slaughtered before the LORD,
content_old: 4 He shall bring the bull to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, before the Lord, and lay his hand upon the head of the bull. The bull shall be slaughtered before the LORD,

content: 5 and the anointed priest shall take some of the bull’s blood and bring it into the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 5 and the anointed priest shall take some of the bull’s blood and bring it into the Tent of Meeting.

content: 6 The priest shall dip his finger in the blood, and sprinkle of the blood seven times before the LORD, in front of the curtain of the Shrine.
content_old: 6 The priest shall dip his finger in the blood, and sprinkle of the blood seven times before the LORD, in front of the curtain of the Shrine.

content: 7 The priest shall put some of the blood on the horns of the altar of aromatic incense, which is in the Tent of Meeting, before the LORD; and all the rest of the bull’s blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 7 The priest shall put some of the blood on the horns of the altar of aromatic incense, which is in the Tent of Meeting, before the LORD; and all the rest of the bull’s blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

content: 8 He shall remove all the fat from the bull of sin offering: the fat that covers the entrails and all the fat that is about the entrails;
content_old: 8 He shall remove all the fat from the bull of sin offering: the fat that covers the entrails and all the fat that is about the entrails;

content: 9 the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, that is at the loins; and the protuberance on the liver, which he shall remove with the kidneys—
content_old: 9 the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, that is at the loins; and the protuberance on the liver, which he shall remove with the kidneys—

content: 10 just as it is removed from the ox of the sacrifice of well-being. The priest shall turn them into smoke on the altar of burnt offering.
content_old: 10 just as it is removed from the ox of the sacrifice of well-being. The priest shall turn them into smoke on the altar of burnt offering.

content: 11 But the hide of the bull, and all its flesh, as well as its head and legs, its entrails and its dung—
content_old: 11 But the hide of the bull, and all its flesh, as well as its head and legs, its entrails and its dung—

content: 12 all the rest of the bull—he shall carry to a clean place outside the camp, to the ash heap, and burn it up in a wood fire; it shall be burned on the ash heap.
content_old: 12 all the rest of the bull—he shall carry to a clean place outside the camp, to the ash heap, and burn it up in a wood fire; it shall be burned on the ash heap.

content: 13 If it is the whole community of Israel that has erred and the matter escapes the notice of the congregation, so that they do any of the things which by the LORD’s commandments ought not to be done, and they realize their guilt—
content_old: 13 If it is the whole community of Israel that has erred and the matter escapes the notice of the congregation, so that they do any of the things which by the LORD’s commandments ought not to be done, and they realize their guilt—

content: 14 when the sin through which they incurred guilt becomes known, the congregation shall offer a bull of the herd as a sin offering, and bring it before the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 14 when the sin through which they incurred guilt becomes known, the congregation shall offer a bull of the herd as a sin offering, and bring it before the Tent of Meeting.

content: 15 The elders of the community shall lay their hands upon the head of the bull before the LORD, and the bull shall be slaughtered before the LORD.
content_old: 15 The elders of the community shall lay their hands upon the head of the bull before the LORD, and the bull shall be slaughtered before the LORD.

content: 16 The anointed priest shall bring some of the blood of the bull into the Tent of Meeting,
content_old: 16 The anointed priest shall bring some of the blood of the bull into the Tent of Meeting,

content: 17 and the priest shall dip his finger in the blood and sprinkle of it seven times before the LORD, in front of the curtain.
content_old: 17 and the priest shall dip his finger in the blood and sprinkle of it seven times before the LORD, in front of the curtain.

content: 18 Some of the blood he shall put on the horns of the altar which is before the LORD in the Tent of Meeting, and all the rest of the blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 18 Some of the blood he shall put on the horns of the altar which is before the LORD in the Tent of Meeting, and all the rest of the blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

content: 19 He shall remove all its fat from it and turn it into smoke on the altar.
content_old: 19 He shall remove all its fat from it and turn it into smoke on the altar.

content: 20 He shall do with this bull just as is done with the priest’sbull of sin offering; he shall do the same with it. Thus the priest shall make expiation for them, and they shall be forgiven.
content_old: 20 He shall do with this bull just as is done with the priest’sbull of sin offering; he shall do the same with it. Thus the priest shall make expiation for them, and they shall be forgiven.

content: 21 He shall carry the bull outside the camp and burn it as he burned the first bull; it is the sin offering of the congregation.
content_old: 21 He shall carry the bull outside the camp and burn it as he burned the first bull; it is the sin offering of the congregation.

content: 22 In case it is a chieftain who incurs guilt by doing unwittingly any of the things which by the commandment of the LORD his God ought not to be done, and he realizes his guilt—
content_old: 22 In case it is a chieftain who incurs guilt by doing unwittingly any of the things which by the commandment of the LORD his God ought not to be done, and he realizes his guilt—

content: 23 or the sin of which he is guilty is brought to his knowledge—he shall bring as his offering a male goat without blemish.
content_old: 23 or the sin of which he is guilty is brought to his knowledge—he shall bring as his offering a male goat without blemish.

content: 24 He shall lay his hand upon the goat’s head, and it shall be slaughtered at the spot where the burnt offering is slaughtered before the LORD; it is a sin offering.
content_old: 24 He shall lay his hand upon the goat’s head, and it shall be slaughtered at the spot where the burnt offering is slaughtered before the LORD; it is a sin offering.

content: 25 The priest shall take with his finger some of the blood of the sin offering and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering; and the rest of its blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar of burnt offering.
content_old: 25 The priest shall take with his finger some of the blood of the sin offering and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering; and the rest of its blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar of burnt offering.

content: 26 All its fat he shall turn into smoke on the altar, like the fat of the sacrifice of well-being. Thus the priest shall make expiation on his behalf for his sin, and he shall be forgiven.
content_old: 26 All its fat he shall turn into smoke on the altar, like the fat of the sacrifice of well-being. Thus the priest shall make expiation on his behalf for his sin, and he shall be forgiven.

content: 27 If any person from among the populace unwittingly incurs guilt by doing any of the things which by the LORD’s commandments ought not to be done, and he realizes his guilt—
content_old: 27 If any person from among the populace unwittingly incurs guilt by doing any of the things which by the LORD’s commandments ought not to be done, and he realizes his guilt—

content: 28 or the sin of which he is guilty is brought to his knowledge—he shall bring a female goat without blemish as his offering for the sin of which he is guilty.
content_old: 28 or the sin of which he is guilty is brought to his knowledge—he shall bring a female goat without blemish as his offering for the sin of which he is guilty.

content: 29 He shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin offering, and the sin offering shall be slaughtered at the place of the burnt offering.
content_old: 29 He shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin offering, and the sin offering shall be slaughtered at the place of the burnt offering.

content: 30 The priest shall take with his finger some of its blood and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering; and all the rest of its blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar.
content_old: 30 The priest shall take with his finger some of its blood and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering; and all the rest of its blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar.

content: 31 He shall remove all its fat, just as the fat is removed from the sacrifice of well-being; and the priest shall turn it into smoke on the altar, for a pleasing odor to the LORD. Thus the priest shall make expiation for him, and he shall be forgiven.
content_old: 31 He shall remove all its fat, just as the fat is removed from the sacrifice of well-being; and the priest shall turn it into smoke on the altar, for a pleasing odor to the LORD. Thus the priest shall make expiation for him, and he shall be forgiven.

content: 32 If the offering he brings as a sin offering is a sheep, he shall bring a female without blemish.
content_old: 32 If the offering he brings as a sin offering is a sheep, he shall bring a female without blemish.

content: 33 He shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin offering, and it shall be slaughtered as a sin offering at the spot where the burnt offering is slaughtered.
content_old: 33 He shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin offering, and it shall be slaughtered as a sin offering at the spot where the burnt offering is slaughtered.

content: 34 The priest shall take with his finger some of the blood of the sin offering and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and all the rest of its blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar.
content_old: 34 The priest shall take with his finger some of the blood of the sin offering and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and all the rest of its blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar.

content: 1 If a person incurs guilt— When he has heard a public imprecation and—although able to testify as one who has either seen or learned of the matter—he does not give information, so that he is subject to punishment;
content_old: 1 If a person incurs guilt— When he has heard a public imprecation and—although able to testify as one who has either seen or learned of the matter—he does not give information, so that he is subject to punishment;

content: 2 Or when a person touches any unclean thing—be it the carcass of an unclean beast or the carcass of unclean cattle or the carcass of an unclean creeping thing—and the fact has escaped him, and then, being unclean, he realizes his guilt;
content_old: 2 Or when a person touches any unclean thing—be it the carcass of an unclean beast or the carcass of unclean cattle or the carcass of an unclean creeping thing—and the fact has escaped him, and then, being unclean, he realizes his guilt;

content: 3 Or when he touches human uncleanness—any such uncleanness whereby one becomes unclean—and, though he has known it, the fact has escaped him, but later he realizes his guilt;
content_old: 3 Or when he touches human uncleanness—any such uncleanness whereby one becomes unclean—and, though he has known it, the fact has escaped him, but later he realizes his guilt;

content: 4 Or when a person utters an oath to bad or good purpose—whatever a man may utter in an oath—and, though he has known it, the fact has escaped him, but later he realizes his guilt in any of these matters—
content_old: 4 Or when a person utters an oath to bad or good purpose—whatever a man may utter in an oath—and, though he has known it, the fact has escaped him, but later he realizes his guilt in any of these matters—

content: 5 when he realizes his guilt in any of these matters, he shall confess that wherein he has sinned.
content_old: 5 when he realizes his guilt in any of these matters, he shall confess that wherein he has sinned.

content: 6 And he shall bring as his penalty to the LORD, for the sin of which he is guilty, a female from the flock, sheep or goat, as a sin offering; and the priest shall make expiation on his behalf for his sin.
content_old: 6 And he shall bring as his penalty to the LORD, for the sin of which he is guilty, a female from the flock, sheep or goat, as a sin offering; and the priest shall make expiation on his behalf for his sin.

content: 7 But if his means do not suffice for a sheep, he shall bring to the LORD, as his penalty for that of which he is guilty, two turtledoves or two pigeons, one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering.
content_old: 7 But if his means do not suffice for a sheep, he shall bring to the LORD, as his penalty for that of which he is guilty, two turtledoves or two pigeons, one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering.

content: 8 He shall bring them to the priest, who shall offer first the one for the sin offering, pinching its head at the nape without severing it.
content_old: 8 He shall bring them to the priest, who shall offer first the one for the sin offering, pinching its head at the nape without severing it.

content: 9 He shall sprinkle some of the blood of the sin offering on the side of the altar, and what remains of the blood shall be drained out at the base of the altar; it is a sin offering.
content_old: 9 He shall sprinkle some of the blood of the sin offering on the side of the altar, and what remains of the blood shall be drained out at the base of the altar; it is a sin offering.

content: 10 And the second he shall prepare as a burnt offering, according to regulation. Thus the priest shall make expiation on his behalf for the sin of which he is guilty, and he shall be forgiven.
content_old: 10 And the second he shall prepare as a burnt offering, according to regulation. Thus the priest shall make expiation on his behalf for the sin of which he is guilty, and he shall be forgiven.

content: 11 And if his means do not suffice for two turtledoves or two pigeons, he shall bring as his offering for that of which he is guilty a tenth of an ephah of choice flour for a sin offering; he shall not add oil to it or lay frankincense on it, for it is a sin offering.
content_old: 11 And if his means do not suffice for two turtledoves or two pigeons, he shall bring as his offering for that of which he is guilty a tenth of an ephah of choice flour for a sin offering; he shall not add oil to it or lay frankincense on it, for it is a sin offering.

content: 12 He shall bring it to the priest, and the priest shall scoop out of it a handful as a token portion of it and turn it into smoke on the altar, with the LORD’s offerings by fire; it is a sin offering.
content_old: 12 He shall bring it to the priest, and the priest shall scoop out of it a handful as a token portion of it and turn it into smoke on the altar, with the LORD’s offerings by fire; it is a sin offering.

content: 13 Thus the priest shall make expiation on his behalf for whichever of these sins he is guilty, and he shall be forgiven. It shall belong to the priest, like the meal offering.
content_old: 13 Thus the priest shall make expiation on his behalf for whichever of these sins he is guilty, and he shall be forgiven. It shall belong to the priest, like the meal offering.

content: 14 And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 14 And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 15 When a person commits a trespass, being unwittingly remiss about any of the LORD’s sacred things, he shall bring as his penalty to the LORD a ram without blemish from the flock, convertible into payment in silver by the sanctuary weight, as a guilt offering.
content_old: 15 When a person commits a trespass, being unwittingly remiss about any of the LORD’s sacred things, he shall bring as his penalty to the LORD a ram without blemish from the flock, convertible into payment in silver by the sanctuary weight, as a guilt offering.

content: 16 He shall make restitution for that wherein he was remiss about the sacred things, and he shall add a fifth part to it and give it to the priest. The priest shall make expiation on his behalf with the ram of the guilt offering, and he shall be forgiven.
content_old: 16 He shall make restitution for that wherein he was remiss about the sacred things, and he shall add a fifth part to it and give it to the priest. The priest shall make expiation on his behalf with the ram of the guilt offering, and he shall be forgiven.

content: 17 And when a person, without knowing it, sins in regard to any of the LORD’s commandments about things not to be done, and then realizes his guilt, he shall be subject to punishment.
content_old: 17 And when a person, without knowing it, sins in regard to any of the LORD’s commandments about things not to be done, and then realizes his guilt, he shall be subject to punishment.

content: 18 He shall bring to the priest a ram without blemish from the flock, or the equivalent, as a guilt offering. The priest shall make expiation on his behalf for the error that he committed unwittingly, and he shall be forgiven.
content_old: 18 He shall bring to the priest a ram without blemish from the flock, or the equivalent, as a guilt offering. The priest shall make expiation on his behalf for the error that he committed unwittingly, and he shall be forgiven.

content: 19 It is a guilt offering; he has incurred guilt before the LORD.
content_old: 19 It is a guilt offering; he has incurred guilt before the LORD.

content: 20 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 20 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 21 When a person sins and commits a trespass against the LORD by dealing deceitfully with his fellow in the matter of a deposit or a pledge, or through robbery, or by defrauding his fellow,
content_old: 21 When a person sins and commits a trespass against the LORD by dealing deceitfully with his fellow in the matter of a deposit or a pledge, or through robbery, or by defrauding his fellow,

content: 22 or by finding something lost and lying about it; if he swears falsely regarding any one of the various things that one may do and sin thereby—
content_old: 22 or by finding something lost and lying about it; if he swears falsely regarding any one of the various things that one may do and sin thereby—

content: 23 when one has thus sinned and, realizing his guilt, would restore that which he got through robbery or fraud, or the deposit that was entrusted to him, or the lost thing that he found,
content_old: 23 when one has thus sinned and, realizing his guilt, would restore that which he got through robbery or fraud, or the deposit that was entrusted to him, or the lost thing that he found,

content: 24 or anything else about which he swore falsely, he shall repay the principal amount and add a fifth part to it. He shall pay it to its owner when he realizes his guilt.
content_old: 24 or anything else about which he swore falsely, he shall repay the principal amount and add a fifth part to it. He shall pay it to its owner when he realizes his guilt.

content: 25 Then he shall bring to the priest, as his penalty to the LORD, a ram without blemish from the flock, or the equivalent, as a guilt offering.
content_old: 25 Then he shall bring to the priest, as his penalty to the LORD, a ram without blemish from the flock, or the equivalent, as a guilt offering.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 Command Aaron and his sons thus: This is the ritual of the burnt offering: The burnt offering itself shall remain where it is burned upon the altar all night until morning, while the fire on the altar is kept going on it.
content_old: 2 Command Aaron and his sons thus: This is the ritual of the burnt offering: The burnt offering itself shall remain where it is burned upon the altar all night until morning, while the fire on the altar is kept going on it.

content: 3 The priest shall dress in linen raiment, with linen breeches next to his body; and he shall take up the ashes to which the fire has reduced the burnt offering on the altar and place them beside the altar.
content_old: 3 The priest shall dress in linen raiment, with linen breeches next to his body; and he shall take up the ashes to which the fire has reduced the burnt offering on the altar and place them beside the altar.

content: 4 He shall then take off his vestments and put on other vestments, and carry the ashes outside the camp to a clean place.
content_old: 4 He shall then take off his vestments and put on other vestments, and carry the ashes outside the camp to a clean place.

content: 5 The fire on the altar shall be kept burning, not to go out: every morning the priest shall feed wood to it, lay out the burnt offering on it, and turn into smoke the fat parts of the offerings of well-being.
content_old: 5 The fire on the altar shall be kept burning, not to go out: every morning the priest shall feed wood to it, lay out the burnt offering on it, and turn into smoke the fat parts of the offerings of well-being.

content: 6 A perpetual fire shall be kept burning on the altar, not to go out.
content_old: 6 A perpetual fire shall be kept burning on the altar, not to go out.

content: 7 And this is the ritual of the meal offering: Aaron’s sons shall present it before the LORD, in front of the altar.
content_old: 7 And this is the ritual of the meal offering: Aaron’s sons shall present it before the LORD, in front of the altar.

content: 8 A handful of the choice flour and oil of the meal offering shall be taken from it, with all the frankincense that is on the meal offering, and this token portion shall be turned into smoke on the altar as a pleasing odor to the LORD.
content_old: 8 A handful of the choice flour and oil of the meal offering shall be taken from it, with all the frankincense that is on the meal offering, and this token portion shall be turned into smoke on the altar as a pleasing odor to the LORD.

content: 9 What is left of it shall be eaten by Aaron and his sons; it shall be eaten as unleavened cakes, in the sacred precinct; they shall eat it in the enclosure of the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 9 What is left of it shall be eaten by Aaron and his sons; it shall be eaten as unleavened cakes, in the sacred precinct; they shall eat it in the enclosure of the Tent of Meeting.

content: 10 It shall not be baked with leaven; I have given it as their portion from My offerings by fire; it is most holy, like the sin offering and the guilt offering.
content_old: 10 It shall not be baked with leaven; I have given it as their portion from My offerings by fire; it is most holy, like the sin offering and the guilt offering.

content: 11 Only the males among Aaron’s descendants may eat of it, as their due for all time throughout the ages from the LORD’s offerings by fire. Anything that touches these shall become holy.
content_old: 11 Only the males among Aaron’s descendants may eat of it, as their due for all time throughout the ages from the LORD’s offerings by fire. Anything that touches these shall become holy.

content: 12 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 12 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 13 This is the offering that Aaron and his sons shall offer to the LORD on the occasion of his anointment: a tenth of an ephah of choice flour as a regular meal offering, half of it in the morning and half of it in the evening,
content_old: 13 This is the offering that Aaron and his sons shall offer to the LORD on the occasion of his anointment: a tenth of an ephah of choice flour as a regular meal offering, half of it in the morning and half of it in the evening,

content: 14 shall be prepared with oil on a griddle. You shall bring it well soaked, and offer it as a meal offering of baked slices, of pleasing odor to the LORD.
content_old: 14 shall be prepared with oil on a griddle. You shall bring it well soaked, and offer it as a meal offering of baked slices, of pleasing odor to the LORD.

content: 15 And so shall the priest, anointed from among his sons to succeed him, prepare it; it is the LORD’s—a law for all time—to be turned entirely into smoke.
content_old: 15 And so shall the priest, anointed from among his sons to succeed him, prepare it; it is the LORD’s—a law for all time—to be turned entirely into smoke.

content: 16 So, too, every meal offering of a priest shall be a whole offering: it shall not be eaten.
content_old: 16 So, too, every meal offering of a priest shall be a whole offering: it shall not be eaten.

content: 17 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 17 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 18 Speak to Aaron and his sons thus: This is the ritual of the sin offering: the sin offering shall be slaughtered before the LORD, at the spot where the burnt offering is slaughtered: it is most holy.
content_old: 18 Speak to Aaron and his sons thus: This is the ritual of the sin offering: the sin offering shall be slaughtered before the LORD, at the spot where the burnt offering is slaughtered: it is most holy.

content: 19 The priest who offers it as a sin offering shall eat of it; it shall be eaten in the sacred precinct, in the enclosure of the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 19 The priest who offers it as a sin offering shall eat of it; it shall be eaten in the sacred precinct, in the enclosure of the Tent of Meeting.

content: 20 Anything that touches its flesh shall become holy; and if any of its blood is spattered upon a garment, you shall wash the bespattered part in the sacred precinct.
content_old: 20 Anything that touches its flesh shall become holy; and if any of its blood is spattered upon a garment, you shall wash the bespattered part in the sacred precinct.

content: 21 An earthen vessel in which it was boiled shall be broken; if it was boiled in a copper vessel, shall be scoured and rinsed with water.
content_old: 21 An earthen vessel in which it was boiled shall be broken; if it was boiled in a copper vessel, shall be scoured and rinsed with water.

content: 22 Only the males in the priestly line may eat of it: it is most holy.
content_old: 22 Only the males in the priestly line may eat of it: it is most holy.

content: 1 This is the ritual of the guilt offering: it is most holy.
content_old: 1 This is the ritual of the guilt offering: it is most holy.

content: 2 The guilt offering shall be slaughtered at the spot where the burnt offering is slaughtered, and the blood shall be dashed on all sides of the altar.
content_old: 2 The guilt offering shall be slaughtered at the spot where the burnt offering is slaughtered, and the blood shall be dashed on all sides of the altar.

content: 3 All its fat shall be offered: the broad tail; the fat that covers the entrails;
content_old: 3 All its fat shall be offered: the broad tail; the fat that covers the entrails;

content: 4 the two kidneys and the fat that is on them at the loins; and the protuberance on the liver, which shall be removed with the kidneys.
content_old: 4 the two kidneys and the fat that is on them at the loins; and the protuberance on the liver, which shall be removed with the kidneys.

content: 5 The priest shall turn them into smoke on the altar as an offering by fire to the LORD; it is a guilt offering.
content_old: 5 The priest shall turn them into smoke on the altar as an offering by fire to the LORD; it is a guilt offering.

content: 6 Only the males in the priestly line may eat of it; it shall be eaten in the sacred precinct: it is most holy.
content_old: 6 Only the males in the priestly line may eat of it; it shall be eaten in the sacred precinct: it is most holy.

content: 7 The guilt offering is like the sin offering. The same rule applies to both: it shall belong to the priest who makes expiation thereby.
content_old: 7 The guilt offering is like the sin offering. The same rule applies to both: it shall belong to the priest who makes expiation thereby.

content: 8 So, too, the priest who offers a man’s burnt offering shall keep the skin of the burnt offering that he offered.
content_old: 8 So, too, the priest who offers a man’s burnt offering shall keep the skin of the burnt offering that he offered.

content: 9 Further, any meal offering that is baked in an oven, and any that is prepared in a pan or on a griddle, shall belong to the priest who offers it.
content_old: 9 Further, any meal offering that is baked in an oven, and any that is prepared in a pan or on a griddle, shall belong to the priest who offers it.

content: 10 But every other meal offering, with oil mixed in or dry, shall go to the sons of Aaron all alike.
content_old: 10 But every other meal offering, with oil mixed in or dry, shall go to the sons of Aaron all alike.

content: 11 This is the ritual of the sacrifice of well-being that one may offer to the LORD:
content_old: 11 This is the ritual of the sacrifice of well-being that one may offer to the LORD:

content: 12 If he offers it for thanksgiving, he shall offer together with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes with oil mixed in, unleavened wafers spread with oil, and cakes of choice flour with oil mixed in, well soaked.
content_old: 12 If he offers it for thanksgiving, he shall offer together with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes with oil mixed in, unleavened wafers spread with oil, and cakes of choice flour with oil mixed in, well soaked.

content: 13 This offering, with cakes of leavened bread added, he shall offer along with his thanksgiving sacrifice of well-being.
content_old: 13 This offering, with cakes of leavened bread added, he shall offer along with his thanksgiving sacrifice of well-being.

content: 14 Out of this he shall offer one of each kind as a gift to the LORD; it shall go to the priest who dashes the blood of the offering of well-being.
content_old: 14 Out of this he shall offer one of each kind as a gift to the LORD; it shall go to the priest who dashes the blood of the offering of well-being.

content: 15 And the flesh of his thanksgiving sacrifice of well-being shall be eaten on the day that it is offered; none of it shall be set aside until morning.
content_old: 15 And the flesh of his thanksgiving sacrifice of well-being shall be eaten on the day that it is offered; none of it shall be set aside until morning.

content: 16 If, however, the sacrifice he offers is a votive or a freewill offering, it shall be eaten on the day that he offers his sacrifice, and what is left of it shall be eaten on the morrow.
content_old: 16 If, however, the sacrifice he offers is a votive or a freewill offering, it shall be eaten on the day that he offers his sacrifice, and what is left of it shall be eaten on the morrow.

content: 17 What is then left of the flesh of the sacrifice shall be consumed in fire on the third day.
content_old: 17 What is then left of the flesh of the sacrifice shall be consumed in fire on the third day.

content: 18 If any of the flesh of his sacrifice of well-being is eaten on the third day, it shall not be acceptable; it shall not count for him who offered it. It is an offensive thing, and the person who eats of it shall bear his guilt.
content_old: 18 If any of the flesh of his sacrifice of well-being is eaten on the third day, it shall not be acceptable; it shall not count for him who offered it. It is an offensive thing, and the person who eats of it shall bear his guilt.

content: 19 Flesh that touches anything unclean shall not be eaten; it shall be consumed in fire. As for other flesh, only he who is clean may eat such flesh.
content_old: 19 Flesh that touches anything unclean shall not be eaten; it shall be consumed in fire. As for other flesh, only he who is clean may eat such flesh.

content: 20 But the person who, in a state of uncleanness, eats flesh from the LORD’s sacrifices of well-being, that person shall be cut off from his kin.
content_old: 20 But the person who, in a state of uncleanness, eats flesh from the LORD’s sacrifices of well-being, that person shall be cut off from his kin.

content: 21 When a person touches anything unclean, be it human uncleanness or an unclean animal or any unclean creature, and eats flesh from the LORD’s sacrifices of well-being, that person shall be cut off from his kin.
content_old: 21 When a person touches anything unclean, be it human uncleanness or an unclean animal or any unclean creature, and eats flesh from the LORD’s sacrifices of well-being, that person shall be cut off from his kin.

content: 22 And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 22 And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 23 Speak to the Israelite people thus: You shall eat no fat of ox or sheep or goat.
content_old: 23 Speak to the Israelite people thus: You shall eat no fat of ox or sheep or goat.

content: 24 Fat from animals that died or were torn by beasts may be put to any use, but you must not eat it.
content_old: 24 Fat from animals that died or were torn by beasts may be put to any use, but you must not eat it.

content: 25 If anyone eats the fat of animals from which offerings by fire may be made to the LORD, the person who eats it shall be cut off from his kin.
content_old: 25 If anyone eats the fat of animals from which offerings by fire may be made to the LORD, the person who eats it shall be cut off from his kin.

content: 26 And you must not consume any blood, either of bird or of animal, in any of your settlements.
content_old: 26 And you must not consume any blood, either of bird or of animal, in any of your settlements.

content: 27 Anyone who eats blood shall be cut off from his kin.
content_old: 27 Anyone who eats blood shall be cut off from his kin.

content: 28 And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 28 And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 29 Speak to the Israelite people thus: The offering to the LORD from a sacrifice of well-being must be presented by him who offers his sacrifice of well-being to the LORD:
content_old: 29 Speak to the Israelite people thus: The offering to the LORD from a sacrifice of well-being must be presented by him who offers his sacrifice of well-being to the LORD:

content: 30 his own hands shall present the LORD’s offerings by fire. He shall present the fat with the breast, the breast to be elevated as an elevation offering before the LORD;
content_old: 30 his own hands shall present the LORD’s offerings by fire. He shall present the fat with the breast, the breast to be elevated as an elevation offering before the LORD;

content: 31 the priest shall turn the fat into smoke on the altar, and the breast shall go to Aaron and his sons.
content_old: 31 the priest shall turn the fat into smoke on the altar, and the breast shall go to Aaron and his sons.

content: 32 And the right thigh from your sacrifices of well-being you shall present to the priest as a gift;
content_old: 32 And the right thigh from your sacrifices of well-being you shall present to the priest as a gift;

content: 33 he from among Aaron’s sons who offers the blood and the fat of the offering of well-being shall get the right thigh as his portion.
content_old: 33 he from among Aaron’s sons who offers the blood and the fat of the offering of well-being shall get the right thigh as his portion.

content: 34 For I have taken the breast of elevation offering and the thigh of gift offering from the Israelites, from their sacrifices of well-being, and given them to Aaron the priest and to his sons as their due from the Israelites for all time.
content_old: 34 For I have taken the breast of elevation offering and the thigh of gift offering from the Israelites, from their sacrifices of well-being, and given them to Aaron the priest and to his sons as their due from the Israelites for all time.

content: 35 Those shall be the perquisites of Aaron and the perquisites of his sons from the LORD’s offerings by fire, once they have been inducted to serve the LORD as priests;
content_old: 35 Those shall be the perquisites of Aaron and the perquisites of his sons from the LORD’s offerings by fire, once they have been inducted to serve the LORD as priests;

content: 36 these the LORD commanded to be given them, once they had been anointed, as a due from the Israelites for all time throughout the ages.
content_old: 36 these the LORD commanded to be given them, once they had been anointed, as a due from the Israelites for all time throughout the ages.

content: 37 Such are the rituals of the burnt offering, the meal offering, the sin offering, the guilt offering, the offering of ordination, and the sacrifice of well-being,
content_old: 37 Such are the rituals of the burnt offering, the meal offering, the sin offering, the guilt offering, the offering of ordination, and the sacrifice of well-being,

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 Take Aaron along with his sons, and the vestments, the anointing oil, the bull of sin offering, the two rams, and the basket of unleavened bread;
content_old: 2 Take Aaron along with his sons, and the vestments, the anointing oil, the bull of sin offering, the two rams, and the basket of unleavened bread;

content: 3 and assemble the whole community at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 3 and assemble the whole community at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

content: 4 Moses did as the LORD commanded him. And when the community was assembled at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting,
content_old: 4 Moses did as the LORD commanded him. And when the community was assembled at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting,

content: 5 Moses said to the community, “This is what the LORD has commanded to be done.”
content_old: 5 Moses said to the community, “This is what the LORD has commanded to be done.”

content: 6 Then Moses brought Aaron and his sons forward and washed them with water.
content_old: 6 Then Moses brought Aaron and his sons forward and washed them with water.

content: 7 He put the tunic on him, girded him with the sash, clothed him with the robe, and put the ephod on him, girding him with the decorated band with which he tied it to him.
content_old: 7 He put the tunic on him, girded him with the sash, clothed him with the robe, and put the ephod on him, girding him with the decorated band with which he tied it to him.

content: 8 He put the breastpiece on him, and put into the breastpiece the Urim and Thummim.
content_old: 8 He put the breastpiece on him, and put into the breastpiece the Urim and Thummim.

content: 9 And he set the headdress on his head; and on the headdress, in front, he put the gold frontlet, the holy diadem—as the LORD had commanded Moses.
content_old: 9 And he set the headdress on his head; and on the headdress, in front, he put the gold frontlet, the holy diadem—as the LORD had commanded Moses.

content: 10 Moses took the anointing oil and anointed the Tabernacle and all that was in it, thus consecrating them.
content_old: 10 Moses took the anointing oil and anointed the Tabernacle and all that was in it, thus consecrating them.

content: 11 He sprinkled some of it on the altar seven times, anointing the altar, all its utensils, and the laver with its stand, to consecrate them.
content_old: 11 He sprinkled some of it on the altar seven times, anointing the altar, all its utensils, and the laver with its stand, to consecrate them.

content: 12 He poured some of the anointing oil upon Aaron’s head and anointed him, to consecrate him.
content_old: 12 He poured some of the anointing oil upon Aaron’s head and anointed him, to consecrate him.

content: 13 Moses then brought Aaron’s sons forward, clothed them in tunics, girded them with sashes, and wound turbans upon them, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
content_old: 13 Moses then brought Aaron’s sons forward, clothed them in tunics, girded them with sashes, and wound turbans upon them, as the LORD had commanded Moses.

content: 14 He led forward the bull of sin offering. Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the bull of sin offering,
content_old: 14 He led forward the bull of sin offering. Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the bull of sin offering,

content: 15 and it was slaughtered. Moses took the blood and with his finger put some on each of the horns of the altar, cleansing the altar; then he poured out the blood at the base of the altar. Thus he consecrated it in order to make expiation upon it.
content_old: 15 and it was slaughtered. Moses took the blood and with his finger put some on each of the horns of the altar, cleansing the altar; then he poured out the blood at the base of the altar. Thus he consecrated it in order to make expiation upon it.

content: 16 Moses then took all the fat that was about the entrails, and the protuberance of the liver, and the two kidneys and their fat, and turned them into smoke on the altar.
content_old: 16 Moses then took all the fat that was about the entrails, and the protuberance of the liver, and the two kidneys and their fat, and turned them into smoke on the altar.

content: 17 The rest of the bull, its hide, its flesh, and its dung, he put to the fire outside the camp—as the LORD had commanded Moses.
content_old: 17 The rest of the bull, its hide, its flesh, and its dung, he put to the fire outside the camp—as the LORD had commanded Moses.

content: 18 Then he brought forward the ram of burnt offering. Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the ram’s head,
content_old: 18 Then he brought forward the ram of burnt offering. Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the ram’s head,

content: 19 and it was slaughtered. Moses dashed the blood against all sides of the altar.
content_old: 19 and it was slaughtered. Moses dashed the blood against all sides of the altar.

content: 20 The ram was cut up into sections and Moses turned the head, the sections, and the suet into smoke on the altar;
content_old: 20 The ram was cut up into sections and Moses turned the head, the sections, and the suet into smoke on the altar;

content: 21 Moses washed the entrails and the legs with water and turned all of the ram into smoke. That was a burnt offering for a pleasing odor, an offering by fire to the LORD—as the LORD had commanded Moses.
content_old: 21 Moses washed the entrails and the legs with water and turned all of the ram into smoke. That was a burnt offering for a pleasing odor, an offering by fire to the LORD—as the LORD had commanded Moses.

content: 22 He brought forward the second ram, the ram of ordination. Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the ram’s head,
content_old: 22 He brought forward the second ram, the ram of ordination. Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the ram’s head,

content: 23 and it was slaughtered. Moses took some of its blood and put it on the ridge of Aaron’s right ear, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.
content_old: 23 and it was slaughtered. Moses took some of its blood and put it on the ridge of Aaron’s right ear, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.

content: 24 Moses then brought forward the sons of Aaron, and put some of the blood on the ridges of their right ears, and on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet; and the rest of the blood Moses dashed against every side of the altar.
content_old: 24 Moses then brought forward the sons of Aaron, and put some of the blood on the ridges of their right ears, and on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet; and the rest of the blood Moses dashed against every side of the altar.

content: 25 He took the fat—the broad tail, all the fat about the entrails, the protuberance of the liver, and the two kidneys and their fat—and the right thigh.
content_old: 25 He took the fat—the broad tail, all the fat about the entrails, the protuberance of the liver, and the two kidneys and their fat—and the right thigh.

content: 26 From the basket of unleavened bread that was before the LORD, he took one cake of unleavened bread, one cake of oil bread, and one wafer, and placed them on the fat parts and on the right thigh.
content_old: 26 From the basket of unleavened bread that was before the LORD, he took one cake of unleavened bread, one cake of oil bread, and one wafer, and placed them on the fat parts and on the right thigh.

content: 27 He placed all these on the palms of Aaron and on the palms of his sons, and elevated them as an elevation offering before the LORD.
content_old: 27 He placed all these on the palms of Aaron and on the palms of his sons, and elevated them as an elevation offering before the LORD.

content: 28 Then Moses took them from their hands and turned them into smoke on the altar with the burnt offering. This was an ordination offering for a pleasing odor; it was an offering by fire to the LORD.
content_old: 28 Then Moses took them from their hands and turned them into smoke on the altar with the burnt offering. This was an ordination offering for a pleasing odor; it was an offering by fire to the LORD.

content: 29 Moses took the breast and elevated it as an elevation offering before the LORD; it was Moses’ portion of the ram of ordination—as the LORD had commanded Moses.
content_old: 29 Moses took the breast and elevated it as an elevation offering before the LORD; it was Moses’ portion of the ram of ordination—as the LORD had commanded Moses.

content: 30 And Moses took some of the anointing oil and some of the blood that was on the altar and sprinkled it upon Aaron and upon his vestments, and also upon his sons and upon their vestments. Thus he consecrated Aaron and his vestments, and also his sons and their vestments.
content_old: 30 And Moses took some of the anointing oil and some of the blood that was on the altar and sprinkled it upon Aaron and upon his vestments, and also upon his sons and upon their vestments. Thus he consecrated Aaron and his vestments, and also his sons and their vestments.

content: 31 Moses said to Aaron and his sons: Boil the flesh at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting and eat it there with the bread that is in the basket of ordination—as I commanded: Aaron and his sons shall eat it;
content_old: 31 Moses said to Aaron and his sons: Boil the flesh at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting and eat it there with the bread that is in the basket of ordination—as I commanded: Aaron and his sons shall eat it;

content: 32 and what is left over of the flesh and the bread you shall consume in fire.
content_old: 32 and what is left over of the flesh and the bread you shall consume in fire.

content: 33 You shall not go outside the entrance of the Tent of Meeting for seven days, until the day that your period of ordination is completed. For your ordination will require seven days.
content_old: 33 You shall not go outside the entrance of the Tent of Meeting for seven days, until the day that your period of ordination is completed. For your ordination will require seven days.

content: 34 Everything done today, the LORD has commanded to be done, to make expiation for you.
content_old: 34 Everything done today, the LORD has commanded to be done, to make expiation for you.

content: 35 You shall remain at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting day and night for seven days, keeping the LORD’s charge—that you may not die—for so I have been commanded.
content_old: 35 You shall remain at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting day and night for seven days, keeping the LORD’s charge—that you may not die—for so I have been commanded.

content: 1 On the eighth day Moses called Aaron and his sons, and the elders of Israel.
content_old: 1 On the eighth day Moses called Aaron and his sons, and the elders of Israel.

content: 2 He said to Aaron: “Take a calf of the herd for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering, without blemish, and bring them before the LORD.
content_old: 2 He said to Aaron: “Take a calf of the herd for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering, without blemish, and bring them before the LORD.

content: 3 And speak to the Israelites, saying: Take a he-goat for a sin offering; a calf and a lamb, yearlings without blemish, for a burnt offering;
content_old: 3 And speak to the Israelites, saying: Take a he-goat for a sin offering; a calf and a lamb, yearlings without blemish, for a burnt offering;

content: 4 and an ox and a ram for an offering of well-being to sacrifice before the LORD; and a meal offering with oil mixed in. For today the LORD will appear to you.”
content_old: 4 and an ox and a ram for an offering of well-being to sacrifice before the LORD; and a meal offering with oil mixed in. For today the LORD will appear to you.”

content: 5 They brought to the front of the Tent of Meeting the things that Moses had commanded, and the whole community came forward and stood before the LORD.
content_old: 5 They brought to the front of the Tent of Meeting the things that Moses had commanded, and the whole community came forward and stood before the LORD.

content: 6 Moses said: “This is what the LORD has commanded that you do, that the Presence of the LORD may appear to you.”
content_old: 6 Moses said: “This is what the LORD has commanded that you do, that the Presence of the LORD may appear to you.”

content: 7 Then Moses said to Aaron: “Come forward to the altar and sacrifice your sin offering and your burnt offering, making expiation for yourself and for the people; and sacrifice the people’s offering and make expiation for them, as the LORD has commanded.”
content_old: 7 Then Moses said to Aaron: “Come forward to the altar and sacrifice your sin offering and your burnt offering, making expiation for yourself and for the people; and sacrifice the people’s offering and make expiation for them, as the LORD has commanded.”

content: 8 Aaron came forward to the altar and slaughtered his calf of sin offering.
content_old: 8 Aaron came forward to the altar and slaughtered his calf of sin offering.

content: 9 Aaron’s sons brought the blood to him; he dipped his finger in the blood and put it on the horns of the altar; and he poured out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
content_old: 9 Aaron’s sons brought the blood to him; he dipped his finger in the blood and put it on the horns of the altar; and he poured out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.

content: 10 The fat, the kidneys, and the protuberance of the liver from the sin offering he turned into smoke on the altar—as the LORD had commanded Moses;
content_old: 10 The fat, the kidneys, and the protuberance of the liver from the sin offering he turned into smoke on the altar—as the LORD had commanded Moses;

content: 11 and the flesh and the skin were consumed in fire outside the camp.
content_old: 11 and the flesh and the skin were consumed in fire outside the camp.

content: 12 Then he slaughtered the burnt offering. Aaron’s sons passed the blood to him, and he dashed it against all sides of the altar.
content_old: 12 Then he slaughtered the burnt offering. Aaron’s sons passed the blood to him, and he dashed it against all sides of the altar.

content: 13 They passed the burnt offering to him in sections, as well as the head, and he turned it into smoke on the altar.
content_old: 13 They passed the burnt offering to him in sections, as well as the head, and he turned it into smoke on the altar.

content: 14 He washed the entrails and the legs, and turned them into smoke on the altar with the burnt offering.
content_old: 14 He washed the entrails and the legs, and turned them into smoke on the altar with the burnt offering.

content: 15 Next he brought forward the people’s offering. He took the goat for the people’s sin offering, and slaughtered it, and presented it as a sin offering like the previous one.
content_old: 15 Next he brought forward the people’s offering. He took the goat for the people’s sin offering, and slaughtered it, and presented it as a sin offering like the previous one.

content: 16 He brought forward the burnt offering and sacrificed it according to regulation.
content_old: 16 He brought forward the burnt offering and sacrificed it according to regulation.

content: 17 He then brought forward the meal offering and, taking a handful of it, he turned it into smoke on the altar—in addition to the burnt offering of the morning.
content_old: 17 He then brought forward the meal offering and, taking a handful of it, he turned it into smoke on the altar—in addition to the burnt offering of the morning.

content: 18 He slaughtered the ox and the ram, the people’s sacrifice of well-being. Aaron’s sons passed the blood to him—which he dashed against every side of the altar—
content_old: 18 He slaughtered the ox and the ram, the people’s sacrifice of well-being. Aaron’s sons passed the blood to him—which he dashed against every side of the altar—

content: 19 and the fat parts of the ox and the ram: the broad tail, the covering fatthe kidneys, and the protuberances of the livers.
content_old: 19 and the fat parts of the ox and the ram: the broad tail, the covering fatthe kidneys, and the protuberances of the livers.

content: 20 They laid these fat parts over the breasts; and Aaron turned the fat parts into smoke on the altar,
content_old: 20 They laid these fat parts over the breasts; and Aaron turned the fat parts into smoke on the altar,

content: 21 and elevated the breasts and the right thighs as an elevation offering before the LORD—as Moses had commanded.
content_old: 21 and elevated the breasts and the right thighs as an elevation offering before the LORD—as Moses had commanded.

content: 22 Aaron lifted his hands toward the people and blessed them; and he stepped down after offering the sin offering, the burnt offering, and the offering of well-being.
content_old: 22 Aaron lifted his hands toward the people and blessed them; and he stepped down after offering the sin offering, the burnt offering, and the offering of well-being.

content: 23 Moses and Aaron then went inside the Tent of Meeting. When they came out, they blessed the people; and the Presence of the Lord appeared to all the people.
content_old: 23 Moses and Aaron then went inside the Tent of Meeting. When they came out, they blessed the people; and the Presence of the Lord appeared to all the people.

content: 1 Now Aaron’s sons Nadab and Abihu each took his fire pan, put fire in it, and laid incense on it; and they offered before the LORD alien fire, which He had not enjoined upon them.
content_old: 1 Now Aaron’s sons Nadab and Abihu each took his fire pan, put fire in it, and laid incense on it; and they offered before the LORD alien fire, which He had not enjoined upon them.

content: 2 And fire came forth from the LORD and consumed them; thus they died at the instance of the LORD.
content_old: 2 And fire came forth from the LORD and consumed them; thus they died at the instance of the LORD.

content: 3 Then Moses said to Aaron, “This is what the LORD meant when He said: Through those near to Me I show Myself holy, And gain glory before all the people.” And Aaron was silent.
content_old: 3 Then Moses said to Aaron, “This is what the LORD meant when He said: Through those near to Me I show Myself holy, And gain glory before all the people.” And Aaron was silent.

content: 4 Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, sons of Uzziel the uncle of Aaron, and said to them, “Come forward and carry your kinsmen away from the front of the sanctuary to a place outside the camp.”
content_old: 4 Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, sons of Uzziel the uncle of Aaron, and said to them, “Come forward and carry your kinsmen away from the front of the sanctuary to a place outside the camp.”

content: 5 They came forward and carried them out of the camp by their tunics, as Moses had ordered.
content_old: 5 They came forward and carried them out of the camp by their tunics, as Moses had ordered.

content: 6 And Moses said to Aaron and to his sons Eleazar and Ithamar, “Do not bare your heads and do not rend your clothes, lest you die and anger strike the whole community. But your kinsmen, all the house of Israel, shall bewail the burning that the LORD has wrought.
content_old: 6 And Moses said to Aaron and to his sons Eleazar and Ithamar, “Do not bare your heads and do not rend your clothes, lest you die and anger strike the whole community. But your kinsmen, all the house of Israel, shall bewail the burning that the LORD has wrought.

content: 7 And so do not go outside the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, lest you die, for the LORD’s anointing oil is upon you.” And they did as Moses had bidden.
content_old: 7 And so do not go outside the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, lest you die, for the LORD’s anointing oil is upon you.” And they did as Moses had bidden.

content: 8 And the LORD spoke to Aaron, saying:
content_old: 8 And the LORD spoke to Aaron, saying:

content: 9 Drink no wine or other intoxicant, you or your sons, when you enter the Tent of Meeting, that you may not die. This is a law for all time throughout the ages,
content_old: 9 Drink no wine or other intoxicant, you or your sons, when you enter the Tent of Meeting, that you may not die. This is a law for all time throughout the ages,

content: 10 for you must distinguish between the sacred and the profane, and between the unclean and the clean;
content_old: 10 for you must distinguish between the sacred and the profane, and between the unclean and the clean;

content: 11 and you must teach the Israelites all the laws which the LORD has imparted to them through Moses.
content_old: 11 and you must teach the Israelites all the laws which the LORD has imparted to them through Moses.

content: 12 Moses spoke to Aaron and to his remaining sons, Eleazar and Ithamar: Take the meal offering that is left over from the LORD’s offerings by fire and eat it unleavened beside the altar, for it is most holy.
content_old: 12 Moses spoke to Aaron and to his remaining sons, Eleazar and Ithamar: Take the meal offering that is left over from the LORD’s offerings by fire and eat it unleavened beside the altar, for it is most holy.

content: 13 You shall eat it in the sacred precinct, inasmuch as it is your due, and that of your children, from the LORD’s offerings by fire; for so I have been commanded.
content_old: 13 You shall eat it in the sacred precinct, inasmuch as it is your due, and that of your children, from the LORD’s offerings by fire; for so I have been commanded.

content: 14 But the breast of elevation offering and the thigh of gift offering you, and your sons and daughters with you, may eat in any clean place, for they have been assigned as a due to you and your children from the Israelites’ sacrifices of well-being.
content_old: 14 But the breast of elevation offering and the thigh of gift offering you, and your sons and daughters with you, may eat in any clean place, for they have been assigned as a due to you and your children from the Israelites’ sacrifices of well-being.

content: 15 Together with the fat of fire offering, they must present the thigh of gift offering and the breast of elevation offering, which are to be elevated as an elevation offering before the LORD, and which are to be your due and that of your children with you for all time—as the LORD has commanded.
content_old: 15 Together with the fat of fire offering, they must present the thigh of gift offering and the breast of elevation offering, which are to be elevated as an elevation offering before the LORD, and which are to be your due and that of your children with you for all time—as the LORD has commanded.

content: 16 Then Moses inquired about the goat of sin offering, and it had already been burned! He was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron’s remaining sons, and said,
content_old: 16 Then Moses inquired about the goat of sin offering, and it had already been burned! He was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron’s remaining sons, and said,

content: 17 “Why did you not eat the sin offering in the sacred area? For it is most holy, and He has given it to you to remove the guilt of the community and to make expiation for them before the LORD.
content_old: 17 “Why did you not eat the sin offering in the sacred area? For it is most holy, and He has given it to you to remove the guilt of the community and to make expiation for them before the LORD.

content: 18 Since its blood was not brought inside the sanctuary, you should certainly have eaten it in the sanctuary, as I commanded.”
content_old: 18 Since its blood was not brought inside the sanctuary, you should certainly have eaten it in the sanctuary, as I commanded.”

content: 19 And Aaron spoke to Moses, “See, this day they brought their sin offering and their burnt offering before the LORD, and such things have befallen me! Had I eaten sin offering today, would the LORD have approved?”
content_old: 19 And Aaron spoke to Moses, “See, this day they brought their sin offering and their burnt offering before the LORD, and such things have befallen me! Had I eaten sin offering today, would the LORD have approved?”

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying to them:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying to them:

content: 2 Speak to the Israelite people thus: These are the creatures that you may eat from among all the land animals:
content_old: 2 Speak to the Israelite people thus: These are the creatures that you may eat from among all the land animals:

content: 3 any animal that has true hoofs, with clefts through the hoofs, and that chews the cud—such you may eat.
content_old: 3 any animal that has true hoofs, with clefts through the hoofs, and that chews the cud—such you may eat.

content: 4 The following, however, of those that either chew the cud or have true hoofs, you shall not eat: the camel—although it chews the cud, it has no true hoofs: it is unclean for you;
content_old: 4 The following, however, of those that either chew the cud or have true hoofs, you shall not eat: the camel—although it chews the cud, it has no true hoofs: it is unclean for you;

content: 5 the daman—although it chews the cud, it has no true hoofs: it is unclean for you;
content_old: 5 the daman—although it chews the cud, it has no true hoofs: it is unclean for you;

content: 6 the hare—although it chews the cud, it has no true hoofs: it is unclean for you;
content_old: 6 the hare—although it chews the cud, it has no true hoofs: it is unclean for you;

content: 7 and the swine—although it has true hoofs, with the hoofs cleft through, it does not chew the cud: it is unclean for you.
content_old: 7 and the swine—although it has true hoofs, with the hoofs cleft through, it does not chew the cud: it is unclean for you.

content: 8 You shall not eat of their flesh or touch their carcasses; they are unclean for you.
content_old: 8 You shall not eat of their flesh or touch their carcasses; they are unclean for you.

content: 9 These you may eat of all that live in water: anything in water, whether in the seas or in the streams, that has fins and scales—these you may eat.
content_old: 9 These you may eat of all that live in water: anything in water, whether in the seas or in the streams, that has fins and scales—these you may eat.
