content: 10 But anything in the seas or in the streams that has no fins and scales, among all the swarming things of the water and among all the other living creatures that are in the water—they are an abomination for you
content_old: 10 But anything in the seas or in the streams that has no fins and scales, among all the swarming things of the water and among all the other living creatures that are in the water—they are an abomination for you

content: 11 and an abomination for you they shall remain: you shall not eat of their flesh and you shall abominate their carcasses.
content_old: 11 and an abomination for you they shall remain: you shall not eat of their flesh and you shall abominate their carcasses.

content: 12 Everything in water that has no fins and scales shall be an abomination for you.
content_old: 12 Everything in water that has no fins and scales shall be an abomination for you.

content: 13 The following you shall abominate among the birds—they shall not be eaten, they are an abomination: the eagle, the vulture, and the black vulture;
content_old: 13 The following you shall abominate among the birds—they shall not be eaten, they are an abomination: the eagle, the vulture, and the black vulture;

content: 14 the kite, falcons of every variety;
content_old: 14 the kite, falcons of every variety;

content: 15 all varieties of raven;
content_old: 15 all varieties of raven;

content: 16 the ostrich, the nighthawk, the sea gull; hawks of every variety;
content_old: 16 the ostrich, the nighthawk, the sea gull; hawks of every variety;

content: 17 the little owl, the cormorant, and the great owl;
content_old: 17 the little owl, the cormorant, and the great owl;

content: 18 the white owl, the pelican, and the bustard;
content_old: 18 the white owl, the pelican, and the bustard;

content: 19 the stork; herons of every variety; the hoopoe, and the bat.
content_old: 19 the stork; herons of every variety; the hoopoe, and the bat.

content: 20 All winged swarming things that walk on fours shall be an abomination for you.
content_old: 20 All winged swarming things that walk on fours shall be an abomination for you.

content: 21 But these you may eat among all the winged swarming things that walk on fours: all that have, above their feet, jointed legs to leap with on the ground—
content_old: 21 But these you may eat among all the winged swarming things that walk on fours: all that have, above their feet, jointed legs to leap with on the ground—

content: 22 of these you may eat the following: locusts of every variety; all varieties of bald locust; crickets of every variety; and all varieties of grasshopper.
content_old: 22 of these you may eat the following: locusts of every variety; all varieties of bald locust; crickets of every variety; and all varieties of grasshopper.

content: 23 But all other winged swarming things that have four legs shall be an abomination for you.
content_old: 23 But all other winged swarming things that have four legs shall be an abomination for you.

content: 24 And the following shall make you unclean—whoever touches their carcasses shall be unclean until evening,
content_old: 24 And the following shall make you unclean—whoever touches their carcasses shall be unclean until evening,

content: 25 and whoever carries the carcasses of any of them shall wash his clothes and be unclean until evening—
content_old: 25 and whoever carries the carcasses of any of them shall wash his clothes and be unclean until evening—

content: 26 every animal that has true hoofs but without clefts through the hoofs, or that does not chew the cud. They are unclean for you; whoever touches them shall be unclean.
content_old: 26 every animal that has true hoofs but without clefts through the hoofs, or that does not chew the cud. They are unclean for you; whoever touches them shall be unclean.

content: 27 Also all animals that walk on paws, among those that walk on fours, are unclean for you; whoever touches their carcasses shall be unclean until evening.
content_old: 27 Also all animals that walk on paws, among those that walk on fours, are unclean for you; whoever touches their carcasses shall be unclean until evening.

content: 28 And anyone who carries their carcasses shall wash his clothes and remain unclean until evening. They are unclean for you.
content_old: 28 And anyone who carries their carcasses shall wash his clothes and remain unclean until evening. They are unclean for you.

content: 29 The following shall be unclean for you from among the things that swarm on the earth: the mole, the mouse, and great lizards of every variety;
content_old: 29 The following shall be unclean for you from among the things that swarm on the earth: the mole, the mouse, and great lizards of every variety;

content: 30 the gecko, the land crocodile, the lizard, the sand lizard, and the chameleon.
content_old: 30 the gecko, the land crocodile, the lizard, the sand lizard, and the chameleon.

content: 31 Those are for you the unclean among all the swarming things; whoever touches them when they are dead shall be unclean until evening.
content_old: 31 Those are for you the unclean among all the swarming things; whoever touches them when they are dead shall be unclean until evening.

content: 32 And anything on which one of them falls when dead shall be unclean: be it any article of wood, or a cloth, or a skin, or a sack—any such article that can be put to use shall be dipped in water, and it shall remain unclean until evening; then it shall be clean.
content_old: 32 And anything on which one of them falls when dead shall be unclean: be it any article of wood, or a cloth, or a skin, or a sack—any such article that can be put to use shall be dipped in water, and it shall remain unclean until evening; then it shall be clean.

content: 33 And if any of those falls into an earthen vessel, everything inside it shall be unclean and the vesselitself you shall break.
content_old: 33 And if any of those falls into an earthen vessel, everything inside it shall be unclean and the vesselitself you shall break.

content: 34 As to any food that may be eaten, it shall become unclean if it came in contact with water; as to any liquid that may be drunk, it shall become unclean if it was inside any vessel.
content_old: 34 As to any food that may be eaten, it shall become unclean if it came in contact with water; as to any liquid that may be drunk, it shall become unclean if it was inside any vessel.

content: 35 Everything on which the carcass of any of them falls shall be unclean: an oven or stove shall be smashed. They are unclean and unclean they shall remain for you.
content_old: 35 Everything on which the carcass of any of them falls shall be unclean: an oven or stove shall be smashed. They are unclean and unclean they shall remain for you.

content: 36 However, a spring or cistern in which water is collected shall be clean, but whoever touches such a carcass in it shall be unclean.
content_old: 36 However, a spring or cistern in which water is collected shall be clean, but whoever touches such a carcass in it shall be unclean.

content: 37 If such a carcass falls upon seed grain that is to be sown, it is clean;
content_old: 37 If such a carcass falls upon seed grain that is to be sown, it is clean;

content: 38 but if water is put on the seed and any part of a carcass falls upon it, it shall be unclean for you.
content_old: 38 but if water is put on the seed and any part of a carcass falls upon it, it shall be unclean for you.

content: 39 If an animal that you may eat has died, anyone who touches its carcass shall be unclean until evening;
content_old: 39 If an animal that you may eat has died, anyone who touches its carcass shall be unclean until evening;

content: 40 anyone who eats of its carcass shall wash his clothes and remain unclean until evening; and anyone who carries its carcass shall wash his clothes and remain unclean until evening.
content_old: 40 anyone who eats of its carcass shall wash his clothes and remain unclean until evening; and anyone who carries its carcass shall wash his clothes and remain unclean until evening.

content: 41 All the things that swarm upon the earth are an abomination; they shall not be eaten.
content_old: 41 All the things that swarm upon the earth are an abomination; they shall not be eaten.

content: 42 You shall not eat, among all things that swarm upon the earth, anything that crawls on its belly, or anything that walks on fours, or anything that has many legs; for they are an abomination.
content_old: 42 You shall not eat, among all things that swarm upon the earth, anything that crawls on its belly, or anything that walks on fours, or anything that has many legs; for they are an abomination.

content: 43 You shall not draw abomination upon yourselves through anything that swarms; you shall not make yourselves unclean therewith and thus become unclean.
content_old: 43 You shall not draw abomination upon yourselves through anything that swarms; you shall not make yourselves unclean therewith and thus become unclean.

content: 44 For I the LORD am your God: you shall sanctify yourselves and be holy, for I am holy. You shall not make yourselves unclean through any swarming thing that moves upon the earth.
content_old: 44 For I the LORD am your God: you shall sanctify yourselves and be holy, for I am holy. You shall not make yourselves unclean through any swarming thing that moves upon the earth.

content: 45 For I the LORD am He who brought you up from the land of Egypt to be your God: you shall be holy, for I am holy.
content_old: 45 For I the LORD am He who brought you up from the land of Egypt to be your God: you shall be holy, for I am holy.

content: 46 These are the instructions concerning animals, birds, all living creatures that move in water, and all creatures that swarm on earth,
content_old: 46 These are the instructions concerning animals, birds, all living creatures that move in water, and all creatures that swarm on earth,

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 Speak to the Israelite people thus: When a woman at childbirth bears a male, she shall be unclean seven days; she shall be unclean as at the time of her menstrual infirmity.—
content_old: 2 Speak to the Israelite people thus: When a woman at childbirth bears a male, she shall be unclean seven days; she shall be unclean as at the time of her menstrual infirmity.—

content: 3 On the eighth day the flesh of his foreskin shall be circumcised.—
content_old: 3 On the eighth day the flesh of his foreskin shall be circumcised.—

content: 4 She shall remain in a state of blood purification for thirty-three days: she shall not touch any consecrated thing, nor enter the sanctuary until her period of purification is completed.
content_old: 4 She shall remain in a state of blood purification for thirty-three days: she shall not touch any consecrated thing, nor enter the sanctuary until her period of purification is completed.

content: 5 If she bears a female, she shall be unclean two weeks as during her menstruation, and she shall remain in a state of blood purification for sixty-six days.
content_old: 5 If she bears a female, she shall be unclean two weeks as during her menstruation, and she shall remain in a state of blood purification for sixty-six days.

content: 6 On the completion of her period of purification, for either son or daughter, she shall bring to the priest, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, a lamb in its first year for a burnt offering, and a pigeon or a turtledove for a sin offering.
content_old: 6 On the completion of her period of purification, for either son or daughter, she shall bring to the priest, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, a lamb in its first year for a burnt offering, and a pigeon or a turtledove for a sin offering.

content: 7 He shall offer it before the LORD and make expiation on her behalf; she shall then be clean from her flow of blood. Such are the rituals concerning her who bears a child, male or female.
content_old: 7 He shall offer it before the LORD and make expiation on her behalf; she shall then be clean from her flow of blood. Such are the rituals concerning her who bears a child, male or female.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

content: 2 When a person has on the skin of his body a swelling, a rash, or a discoloration, and it develops into a scaly affection on the skin of his body, it shall be reported to Aaron the priest or to one of his sons, the priests.
content_old: 2 When a person has on the skin of his body a swelling, a rash, or a discoloration, and it develops into a scaly affection on the skin of his body, it shall be reported to Aaron the priest or to one of his sons, the priests.

content: 3 The priest shall examine the affection on the skin of his body: if hair in the affected patch has turned white and the affection appears to be deeper than the skin of his body, it is a leprous affection; when the priest sees it, he shall pronounce him unclean.
content_old: 3 The priest shall examine the affection on the skin of his body: if hair in the affected patch has turned white and the affection appears to be deeper than the skin of his body, it is a leprous affection; when the priest sees it, he shall pronounce him unclean.

content: 4 But if it is a white discoloration on the skin of his body which does not appear to be deeper than the skin and the hair in it has not turned white, the priest shall isolate the affected person for seven days.
content_old: 4 But if it is a white discoloration on the skin of his body which does not appear to be deeper than the skin and the hair in it has not turned white, the priest shall isolate the affected person for seven days.

content: 5 On the seventh day the priest shall examine him, and if the affection has remained unchanged in color and the disease has not spread on the skin, the priest shall isolate him for another seven days.
content_old: 5 On the seventh day the priest shall examine him, and if the affection has remained unchanged in color and the disease has not spread on the skin, the priest shall isolate him for another seven days.

content: 6 On the seventh day the priest shall examine him again: if the affection has faded and has not spread on the skin, the priest shall pronounce him clean. It is a rash; he shall wash his clothes, and he shall be clean.
content_old: 6 On the seventh day the priest shall examine him again: if the affection has faded and has not spread on the skin, the priest shall pronounce him clean. It is a rash; he shall wash his clothes, and he shall be clean.

content: 7 But if the rash should spread on the skin after he has presented himself to the priest and been pronounced clean, he shall present himself again to the priest.
content_old: 7 But if the rash should spread on the skin after he has presented himself to the priest and been pronounced clean, he shall present himself again to the priest.

content: 8 And if the priest sees that the rash has spread on the skin, the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is leprosy.
content_old: 8 And if the priest sees that the rash has spread on the skin, the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is leprosy.

content: 9 When a person has a scaly affection, it shall be reported to the priest.
content_old: 9 When a person has a scaly affection, it shall be reported to the priest.

content: 10 If the priest finds on the skin a white swelling which has turned some hair white, with a patch of undiscolored flesh in the swelling,
content_old: 10 If the priest finds on the skin a white swelling which has turned some hair white, with a patch of undiscolored flesh in the swelling,

content: 11 it is chronic leprosy on the skin of his body, and the priest shall pronounce him unclean; he need not isolate him, for he is unclean.
content_old: 11 it is chronic leprosy on the skin of his body, and the priest shall pronounce him unclean; he need not isolate him, for he is unclean.

content: 12 If the eruption spreads out over the skin so that it covers all the skin of the affected person from head to foot, wherever the priest can see—
content_old: 12 If the eruption spreads out over the skin so that it covers all the skin of the affected person from head to foot, wherever the priest can see—

content: 13 if the priest sees that the eruption has covered the whole body—he shall pronounce the affected person clean; he is clean, for he has turned all white.
content_old: 13 if the priest sees that the eruption has covered the whole body—he shall pronounce the affected person clean; he is clean, for he has turned all white.

content: 14 But as soon as undiscolored flesh appears in it, he shall be unclean;
content_old: 14 But as soon as undiscolored flesh appears in it, he shall be unclean;

content: 15 when the priest sees the undiscolored flesh, he shall pronounce him unclean. The undiscolored flesh is unclean; it is leprosy.
content_old: 15 when the priest sees the undiscolored flesh, he shall pronounce him unclean. The undiscolored flesh is unclean; it is leprosy.

content: 16 But if the undiscolored flesh again turns white, he shall come to the priest,
content_old: 16 But if the undiscolored flesh again turns white, he shall come to the priest,

content: 17 and the priest shall examine him: if the affection has turned white, the priest shall pronounce the affected person clean; he is clean.
content_old: 17 and the priest shall examine him: if the affection has turned white, the priest shall pronounce the affected person clean; he is clean.

content: 18 When an inflammation appears on the skin of one’s body and it heals,
content_old: 18 When an inflammation appears on the skin of one’s body and it heals,

content: 19 and a white swelling or a white discoloration streaked with red develops where the inflammation was, he shall present himself to the priest.
content_old: 19 and a white swelling or a white discoloration streaked with red develops where the inflammation was, he shall present himself to the priest.

content: 20 If the priest finds that it appears lower than the rest of the skin and that the hair in it has turned white, the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is a leprous affection that has broken out in the inflammation.
content_old: 20 If the priest finds that it appears lower than the rest of the skin and that the hair in it has turned white, the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is a leprous affection that has broken out in the inflammation.

content: 21 But if the priest finds that there is no white hair in it and it is not lower than the rest of the skin, and it is faded, the priest shall isolate him for seven days.
content_old: 21 But if the priest finds that there is no white hair in it and it is not lower than the rest of the skin, and it is faded, the priest shall isolate him for seven days.

content: 22 If it should spread in the skin, the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is an affection.
content_old: 22 If it should spread in the skin, the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is an affection.

content: 23 But if the discoloration remains stationary, not having spread, it is the scar of the inflammation; the priest shall pronounce him clean.
content_old: 23 But if the discoloration remains stationary, not having spread, it is the scar of the inflammation; the priest shall pronounce him clean.

content: 24 When the skin of one’s body sustains a burn by fire, and the patch from the burn is a discoloration, either white streaked with red, or white,
content_old: 24 When the skin of one’s body sustains a burn by fire, and the patch from the burn is a discoloration, either white streaked with red, or white,

content: 25 the priest shall examine it. If some hair has turned white in the discoloration, which itself appears to go deeper than the skin, it is leprosy that has broken out in the burn. The priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is a leprous affection.
content_old: 25 the priest shall examine it. If some hair has turned white in the discoloration, which itself appears to go deeper than the skin, it is leprosy that has broken out in the burn. The priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is a leprous affection.

content: 26 But if the priest finds that there is no white hair in the discoloration, and that it is not lower than the rest of the skin, and it is faded, the priest shall isolate him for seven days.
content_old: 26 But if the priest finds that there is no white hair in the discoloration, and that it is not lower than the rest of the skin, and it is faded, the priest shall isolate him for seven days.

content: 27 On the seventh day the priest shall examine him: if it has spread in the skin, the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is a leprous affection.
content_old: 27 On the seventh day the priest shall examine him: if it has spread in the skin, the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is a leprous affection.

content: 28 But if the discoloration has remained stationary, not having spread on the skin, and it is faded, it is the swelling from the burn. The priest shall pronounce him clean, for it is the scar of the burn.
content_old: 28 But if the discoloration has remained stationary, not having spread on the skin, and it is faded, it is the swelling from the burn. The priest shall pronounce him clean, for it is the scar of the burn.

content: 29 If a man or a woman has an affection on the head or in the beard,
content_old: 29 If a man or a woman has an affection on the head or in the beard,

content: 30 the priest shall examine the affection. If it appears to go deeper than the skin and there is thin yellow hair in it, the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is a scall, a scaly eruption in the hair or beard.
content_old: 30 the priest shall examine the affection. If it appears to go deeper than the skin and there is thin yellow hair in it, the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is a scall, a scaly eruption in the hair or beard.

content: 31 But if the priest finds that the scall affection does not appear to go deeper than the skin, yet there is no black hair in it, the priest shall isolate the person with the scall affection for seven days.
content_old: 31 But if the priest finds that the scall affection does not appear to go deeper than the skin, yet there is no black hair in it, the priest shall isolate the person with the scall affection for seven days.

content: 32 On the seventh day the priest shall examine the affection. If the scall has not spread and no yellow hair has appeared in it, and the scall does not appear to go deeper than the skin,
content_old: 32 On the seventh day the priest shall examine the affection. If the scall has not spread and no yellow hair has appeared in it, and the scall does not appear to go deeper than the skin,

content: 33 the person with the scall shall shave himself, but without shaving the scall; the priest shall isolate him for another seven days.
content_old: 33 the person with the scall shall shave himself, but without shaving the scall; the priest shall isolate him for another seven days.

content: 34 On the seventh day the priest shall examine the scall. If the scall has not spread on the skin, and does not appear to go deeper than the skin, the priest shall pronounce him clean; he shall wash his clothes, and he shall be clean.
content_old: 34 On the seventh day the priest shall examine the scall. If the scall has not spread on the skin, and does not appear to go deeper than the skin, the priest shall pronounce him clean; he shall wash his clothes, and he shall be clean.

content: 35 If, however, the scall should spread on the skin after he has been pronounced clean,
content_old: 35 If, however, the scall should spread on the skin after he has been pronounced clean,

content: 36 the priest shall examine him. If the scall has spread on the skin, the priest need not look for yellow hair: he is unclean.
content_old: 36 the priest shall examine him. If the scall has spread on the skin, the priest need not look for yellow hair: he is unclean.

content: 37 But if the scall has remained unchanged in color, and black hair has grown in it, the scall is healed; he is clean. The priest shall pronounce him clean.
content_old: 37 But if the scall has remained unchanged in color, and black hair has grown in it, the scall is healed; he is clean. The priest shall pronounce him clean.

content: 38 If a man or a woman has the skin of the body streaked with white discolorations,
content_old: 38 If a man or a woman has the skin of the body streaked with white discolorations,

content: 39 and the priest sees that the discolorations on the skin of the body are of a dull white, it is a tetter broken out on the skin; he is clean.
content_old: 39 and the priest sees that the discolorations on the skin of the body are of a dull white, it is a tetter broken out on the skin; he is clean.

content: 40 If a man loses the hair of his head and becomes bald, he is clean.
content_old: 40 If a man loses the hair of his head and becomes bald, he is clean.

content: 41 If he loses the hair on the front part of his head and becomes bald at the forehead, he is clean.
content_old: 41 If he loses the hair on the front part of his head and becomes bald at the forehead, he is clean.

content: 42 But if a white affection streaked with red appears on the bald part in the front or at the back of the head, it is a scaly eruption that is spreading over the bald part in the front or at the back of the head.
content_old: 42 But if a white affection streaked with red appears on the bald part in the front or at the back of the head, it is a scaly eruption that is spreading over the bald part in the front or at the back of the head.

content: 43 The priest shall examine him: if the swollen affection on the bald part in the front or at the back of his head is white streaked with red, like the leprosy of body skin in appearance,
content_old: 43 The priest shall examine him: if the swollen affection on the bald part in the front or at the back of his head is white streaked with red, like the leprosy of body skin in appearance,

content: 44 the man is leprous; he is unclean. The priest shall pronounce him unclean; he has the affection on his head.
content_old: 44 the man is leprous; he is unclean. The priest shall pronounce him unclean; he has the affection on his head.

content: 45 As for the person with a leprous affection, his clothes shall be rent, his head shall be left bare, and he shall cover over his upper lip; and he shall call out, “Unclean! Unclean!”
content_old: 45 As for the person with a leprous affection, his clothes shall be rent, his head shall be left bare, and he shall cover over his upper lip; and he shall call out, “Unclean! Unclean!”

content: 46 He shall be unclean as long as the disease is on him. Being unclean, he shall dwell apart; his dwelling shall be outside the camp.
content_old: 46 He shall be unclean as long as the disease is on him. Being unclean, he shall dwell apart; his dwelling shall be outside the camp.

content: 47 When an eruptive affection occurs in a cloth of wool or linen fabric,
content_old: 47 When an eruptive affection occurs in a cloth of wool or linen fabric,

content: 48 in the warp or in the woof of the linen or the wool, or in a skin or in anything made of skin;
content_old: 48 in the warp or in the woof of the linen or the wool, or in a skin or in anything made of skin;

content: 49 if the affection in the cloth or the skin, in the warp or the woof, or in any article of skin, is streaky green or red, it is an eruptive affection. It shall be shown to the priest;
content_old: 49 if the affection in the cloth or the skin, in the warp or the woof, or in any article of skin, is streaky green or red, it is an eruptive affection. It shall be shown to the priest;

content: 50 and the priest, after examining the affection, shall isolate the affected article for seven days.
content_old: 50 and the priest, after examining the affection, shall isolate the affected article for seven days.

content: 51 On the seventh day he shall examine the affection: if the affection has spread in the cloth—whether in the warp or the woof, or in the skin, for whatever purpose the skin may be used—the affection is a malignant eruption; it is unclean.
content_old: 51 On the seventh day he shall examine the affection: if the affection has spread in the cloth—whether in the warp or the woof, or in the skin, for whatever purpose the skin may be used—the affection is a malignant eruption; it is unclean.

content: 52 The cloth—whether warp or woof in wool or linen, or any article of skin—in which the affection is found, shall be burned, for it is a malignant eruption; it shall be consumed in fire.
content_old: 52 The cloth—whether warp or woof in wool or linen, or any article of skin—in which the affection is found, shall be burned, for it is a malignant eruption; it shall be consumed in fire.

content: 53 But if the priest sees that the affection in the cloth—whether in warp or in woof, or in any article of skin—has not spread,
content_old: 53 But if the priest sees that the affection in the cloth—whether in warp or in woof, or in any article of skin—has not spread,

content: 54 the priest shall order the affected article washed, and he shall isolate it for another seven days.
content_old: 54 the priest shall order the affected article washed, and he shall isolate it for another seven days.

content: 55 And if, after the affected article has been washed, the priest sees that the affection has not changed color and that it has not spread, it is unclean. It shall be consumed in fire; it is a fret, whether on its inner side or on its outer side.
content_old: 55 And if, after the affected article has been washed, the priest sees that the affection has not changed color and that it has not spread, it is unclean. It shall be consumed in fire; it is a fret, whether on its inner side or on its outer side.

content: 56 But if the priest sees that the affected part, after it has been washed, is faded, he shall tear it out from the cloth or skin, whether in the warp or in the woof;
content_old: 56 But if the priest sees that the affected part, after it has been washed, is faded, he shall tear it out from the cloth or skin, whether in the warp or in the woof;

content: 57 and if it occurs again in the cloth—whether in warp or in woof—or in any article of skin, it is a wild growth; the affected article shall be consumed in fire.
content_old: 57 and if it occurs again in the cloth—whether in warp or in woof—or in any article of skin, it is a wild growth; the affected article shall be consumed in fire.

content: 58 If, however, the affection disappears from the cloth—warp or woof—or from any article of skin that has been washed, it shall be washed again, and it shall be clean.
content_old: 58 If, however, the affection disappears from the cloth—warp or woof—or from any article of skin that has been washed, it shall be washed again, and it shall be clean.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 This shall be the ritual for a leper at the time that he is to be cleansed. When it has been reported to the priest,
content_old: 2 This shall be the ritual for a leper at the time that he is to be cleansed. When it has been reported to the priest,

content: 3 the priest shall go outside the camp. If the priest sees that the leper has been healed of his scaly affection,
content_old: 3 the priest shall go outside the camp. If the priest sees that the leper has been healed of his scaly affection,

content: 4 the priest shall order two live clean birds, cedar wood, crimson stuff, and hyssop to be brought for him who is to be cleansed.
content_old: 4 the priest shall order two live clean birds, cedar wood, crimson stuff, and hyssop to be brought for him who is to be cleansed.

content: 5 The priest shall order one of the birds slaughtered over fresh water in an earthen vessel;
content_old: 5 The priest shall order one of the birds slaughtered over fresh water in an earthen vessel;

content: 6 and he shall take the live bird, along with the cedar wood, the crimson stuff, and the hyssop, and dip them together with the live bird in the blood of the bird that was slaughtered over the fresh water.
content_old: 6 and he shall take the live bird, along with the cedar wood, the crimson stuff, and the hyssop, and dip them together with the live bird in the blood of the bird that was slaughtered over the fresh water.

content: 7 He shall then sprinkle it seven times on him who is to be cleansed of the eruption and cleanse him; and he shall set the live bird free in the open country.
content_old: 7 He shall then sprinkle it seven times on him who is to be cleansed of the eruption and cleanse him; and he shall set the live bird free in the open country.

content: 8 The one to be cleansed shall wash his clothes, shave off all his hair, and bathe in water; then he shall be clean. After that he may enter the camp, but he must remain outside his tent seven days.
content_old: 8 The one to be cleansed shall wash his clothes, shave off all his hair, and bathe in water; then he shall be clean. After that he may enter the camp, but he must remain outside his tent seven days.

content: 9 On the seventh day he shall shave off all his hair—of head, beard, and eyebrows. When he has shaved off all his hair, he shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water; then he shall be clean.
content_old: 9 On the seventh day he shall shave off all his hair—of head, beard, and eyebrows. When he has shaved off all his hair, he shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water; then he shall be clean.

content: 10 On the eighth day he shall take two male lambs without blemish, one ewe lamb in its first year without blemish, three-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in for a meal offering, and one log of oil.
content_old: 10 On the eighth day he shall take two male lambs without blemish, one ewe lamb in its first year without blemish, three-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in for a meal offering, and one log of oil.

content: 11 These shall be presented before the LORD, with the man to be cleansed, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, by the priest who performs the cleansing.
content_old: 11 These shall be presented before the LORD, with the man to be cleansed, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, by the priest who performs the cleansing.

content: 12 The priest shall take one of the male lambs and offer it with the log of oil as a guilt offering, and he shall elevate them as an elevation offering before the LORD.
content_old: 12 The priest shall take one of the male lambs and offer it with the log of oil as a guilt offering, and he shall elevate them as an elevation offering before the LORD.

content: 13 The lamb shall be slaughtered at the spot in the sacred area where the sin offering and the burnt offering are slaughtered. For the guilt offering, like the sin offering, goes to the priest; it is most holy.
content_old: 13 The lamb shall be slaughtered at the spot in the sacred area where the sin offering and the burnt offering are slaughtered. For the guilt offering, like the sin offering, goes to the priest; it is most holy.

content: 14 The priest shall take some of the blood of the guilt offering, and the priest shall put it on the ridge of the right ear of him who is being cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.
content_old: 14 The priest shall take some of the blood of the guilt offering, and the priest shall put it on the ridge of the right ear of him who is being cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.

content: 15 The priest shall then take some of the log of oil and pour it into the palm of his own left hand.
content_old: 15 The priest shall then take some of the log of oil and pour it into the palm of his own left hand.

content: 16 And the priest shall dip his right finger in the oil that is in the palm of his left hand and sprinkle some of the oil with his finger seven times before the LORD.
content_old: 16 And the priest shall dip his right finger in the oil that is in the palm of his left hand and sprinkle some of the oil with his finger seven times before the LORD.

content: 17 Some of the oil left in his palm shall be put by the priest on the ridge of the right ear of the one being cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot—over the blood of the guilt offering.
content_old: 17 Some of the oil left in his palm shall be put by the priest on the ridge of the right ear of the one being cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot—over the blood of the guilt offering.

content: 18 The rest of the oil in his palm the priest shall put on the head of the one being cleansed. Thus the priest shall make expiation for him before the LORD.
content_old: 18 The rest of the oil in his palm the priest shall put on the head of the one being cleansed. Thus the priest shall make expiation for him before the LORD.

content: 19 The priest shall then offer the sin offering and make expiation for the one being cleansed of his uncleanness. Last, the burnt offering shall be slaughtered,
content_old: 19 The priest shall then offer the sin offering and make expiation for the one being cleansed of his uncleanness. Last, the burnt offering shall be slaughtered,

content: 20 and the priest shall offer the burnt offering and the meal offering on the altar, and the priest shall make expiation for him. Then he shall be clean.
content_old: 20 and the priest shall offer the burnt offering and the meal offering on the altar, and the priest shall make expiation for him. Then he shall be clean.

content: 21 If, however, he is poor and his means are insufficient, he shall take one male lamb for a guilt offering, to be elevated in expiation for him, one-tenth of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in for a meal offering, and a log of oil;
content_old: 21 If, however, he is poor and his means are insufficient, he shall take one male lamb for a guilt offering, to be elevated in expiation for him, one-tenth of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in for a meal offering, and a log of oil;

content: 22 and two turtledoves or two pigeons, depending on his means, the one to be the sin offering and the other the burnt offering.
content_old: 22 and two turtledoves or two pigeons, depending on his means, the one to be the sin offering and the other the burnt offering.

content: 23 On the eighth day of his cleansing he shall bring them to the priest at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, before the LORD.
content_old: 23 On the eighth day of his cleansing he shall bring them to the priest at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, before the LORD.

content: 24 The priest shall take the lamb of guilt offering and the log of oil, and elevate them as an elevation offering before the LORD.
content_old: 24 The priest shall take the lamb of guilt offering and the log of oil, and elevate them as an elevation offering before the LORD.

content: 25 When the lamb of guilt offering has been slaughtered, the priest shall take some of the blood of the guilt offering and put it on the ridge of the right ear of the one being cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.
content_old: 25 When the lamb of guilt offering has been slaughtered, the priest shall take some of the blood of the guilt offering and put it on the ridge of the right ear of the one being cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.

content: 26 The priest shall then pour some of the oil into the palm of his own left hand,
content_old: 26 The priest shall then pour some of the oil into the palm of his own left hand,

content: 27 and with the finger of his right hand the priest shall sprinkle some of the oil that is in the palm of his left hand seven times before the LORD.
content_old: 27 and with the finger of his right hand the priest shall sprinkle some of the oil that is in the palm of his left hand seven times before the LORD.

content: 28 Some of the oil in his palm shall be put by the priest on the ridge of the right ear of the one being cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot, over the same places as the blood of the guilt offering;
content_old: 28 Some of the oil in his palm shall be put by the priest on the ridge of the right ear of the one being cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot, over the same places as the blood of the guilt offering;

content: 29 and what is left of the oil in his palm the priest shall put on the head of the one being cleansed, to make expiation for him before the LORD.
content_old: 29 and what is left of the oil in his palm the priest shall put on the head of the one being cleansed, to make expiation for him before the LORD.

content: 30 He shall then offer one of the turtledoves or pigeons, depending on his means—
content_old: 30 He shall then offer one of the turtledoves or pigeons, depending on his means—

content: 31 whichever he can afford—the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, together with the meal offering. Thus the priest shall make expiation before the LORD for the one being cleansed.
content_old: 31 whichever he can afford—the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, together with the meal offering. Thus the priest shall make expiation before the LORD for the one being cleansed.

content: 32 Such is the ritual for him who has a scaly affection and whose means for his cleansing are limited.
content_old: 32 Such is the ritual for him who has a scaly affection and whose means for his cleansing are limited.

content: 33 The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
content_old: 33 The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

content: 34 When you enter the land of Canaan that I give you as a possession, and I inflict an eruptive plague upon a house in the land you possess,
content_old: 34 When you enter the land of Canaan that I give you as a possession, and I inflict an eruptive plague upon a house in the land you possess,

content: 35 the owner of the house shall come and tell the priest, saying, “Something like a plague has appeared upon my house.”
content_old: 35 the owner of the house shall come and tell the priest, saying, “Something like a plague has appeared upon my house.”

content: 36 The priest shall order the house cleared before the priest enters to examine the plague, so that nothing in the house may become unclean; after that the priest shall enter to examine the house.
content_old: 36 The priest shall order the house cleared before the priest enters to examine the plague, so that nothing in the house may become unclean; after that the priest shall enter to examine the house.

content: 37 If, when he examines the plague, the plague in the walls of the house is found to consist of greenish or reddish streaks that appear to go deep into the wall,
content_old: 37 If, when he examines the plague, the plague in the walls of the house is found to consist of greenish or reddish streaks that appear to go deep into the wall,

content: 38 the priest shall come out of the house to the entrance of the house, and close up the house for seven days.
content_old: 38 the priest shall come out of the house to the entrance of the house, and close up the house for seven days.

content: 39 On the seventh day the priest shall return. If he sees that the plague has spread on the walls of the house,
content_old: 39 On the seventh day the priest shall return. If he sees that the plague has spread on the walls of the house,

content: 40 the priest shall order the stones with the plague in them to be pulled out and cast outside the city into an unclean place.
content_old: 40 the priest shall order the stones with the plague in them to be pulled out and cast outside the city into an unclean place.

content: 41 The house shall be scraped inside all around, and the coating that is scraped off shall be dumped outside the city in an unclean place.
content_old: 41 The house shall be scraped inside all around, and the coating that is scraped off shall be dumped outside the city in an unclean place.

content: 42 They shall take other stones and replace those stones with them, and take other coating and plaster the house.
content_old: 42 They shall take other stones and replace those stones with them, and take other coating and plaster the house.

content: 43 If the plague again breaks out in the house, after the stones have been pulled out and after the house has been scraped and replastered,
content_old: 43 If the plague again breaks out in the house, after the stones have been pulled out and after the house has been scraped and replastered,

content: 44 the priest shall come to examine: if the plague has spread in the house, it is a malignant eruption in the house; it is unclean.
content_old: 44 the priest shall come to examine: if the plague has spread in the house, it is a malignant eruption in the house; it is unclean.

content: 45 The house shall be torn down—its stones and timber and all the coating on the house—and taken to an unclean place outside the city.
content_old: 45 The house shall be torn down—its stones and timber and all the coating on the house—and taken to an unclean place outside the city.

content: 46 Whoever enters the house while it is closed up shall be unclean until evening.
content_old: 46 Whoever enters the house while it is closed up shall be unclean until evening.

content: 47 Whoever sleeps in the house must wash his clothes, and whoever eats in the house must wash his clothes.
content_old: 47 Whoever sleeps in the house must wash his clothes, and whoever eats in the house must wash his clothes.

content: 48 If, however, the priest comes and sees that the plague has not spread in the house after the house was replastered, the priest shall pronounce the house clean, for the plague has healed.
content_old: 48 If, however, the priest comes and sees that the plague has not spread in the house after the house was replastered, the priest shall pronounce the house clean, for the plague has healed.

content: 49 To purge the house, he shall take two birds, cedar wood, crimson stuff, and hyssop.
content_old: 49 To purge the house, he shall take two birds, cedar wood, crimson stuff, and hyssop.

content: 50 He shall slaughter the one bird over fresh water in an earthen vessel.
content_old: 50 He shall slaughter the one bird over fresh water in an earthen vessel.

content: 51 He shall take the cedar wood, the hyssop, the crimson stuff, and the live bird, and dip them in the blood of the slaughtered bird and the fresh water, and sprinkle on the house seven times.
content_old: 51 He shall take the cedar wood, the hyssop, the crimson stuff, and the live bird, and dip them in the blood of the slaughtered bird and the fresh water, and sprinkle on the house seven times.

content: 52 Having purged the house with the blood of the bird, the fresh water, the live bird, the cedar wood, the hyssop, and the crimson stuff,
content_old: 52 Having purged the house with the blood of the bird, the fresh water, the live bird, the cedar wood, the hyssop, and the crimson stuff,

content: 53 he shall set the live bird free outside the city in the open country. Thus he shall make expiation for the house, and it shall be clean.
content_old: 53 he shall set the live bird free outside the city in the open country. Thus he shall make expiation for the house, and it shall be clean.

content: 54 Such is the ritual for every eruptive affection—for scalls,
content_old: 54 Such is the ritual for every eruptive affection—for scalls,

content: 55 for an eruption on a cloth or a house,
content_old: 55 for an eruption on a cloth or a house,

content: 56 for swellings, for rashes, or for discolorations—

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

content: 2 Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When any man has a discharge issuing from his member, he is unclean.
content_old: 2 Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When any man has a discharge issuing from his member, he is unclean.

content: 3 The uncleanness from his discharge shall mean the following—whether his member runs with the discharge or is stopped up so that there is no discharge, his uncleanness means this:
content_old: 3 The uncleanness from his discharge shall mean the following—whether his member runs with the discharge or is stopped up so that there is no discharge, his uncleanness means this:

content: 4 Any bedding on which the one with the discharge lies shall be unclean, and every object on which he sits shall be unclean.
content_old: 4 Any bedding on which the one with the discharge lies shall be unclean, and every object on which he sits shall be unclean.

content: 5 Anyone who touches his bedding shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.
content_old: 5 Anyone who touches his bedding shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.

content: 6 Whoever sits on an object on which the one with the discharge has sat shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.
content_old: 6 Whoever sits on an object on which the one with the discharge has sat shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.

content: 7 Whoever touches the body of the one with the discharge shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.
content_old: 7 Whoever touches the body of the one with the discharge shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.

content: 8 If one with a discharge spits on one who is clean, the latter shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.
content_old: 8 If one with a discharge spits on one who is clean, the latter shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.

content: 9 Any means for riding that one with a discharge has mounted shall be unclean;
content_old: 9 Any means for riding that one with a discharge has mounted shall be unclean;

content: 10 whoever touches anything that was under him shall be unclean until evening; and whoever carries such things shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.
content_old: 10 whoever touches anything that was under him shall be unclean until evening; and whoever carries such things shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.

content: 11 If one with a discharge, without having rinsed his hands in water, touches another person, that person shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.
content_old: 11 If one with a discharge, without having rinsed his hands in water, touches another person, that person shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.

content: 12 An earthen vessel that one with a discharge touches shall be broken; and any wooden implement shall be rinsed with water.
content_old: 12 An earthen vessel that one with a discharge touches shall be broken; and any wooden implement shall be rinsed with water.

content: 13 When one with a discharge becomes clean of his discharge, he shall count off seven days for his cleansing, wash his clothes, and bathe his body in fresh water; then he shall be clean.
content_old: 13 When one with a discharge becomes clean of his discharge, he shall count off seven days for his cleansing, wash his clothes, and bathe his body in fresh water; then he shall be clean.

content: 14 On the eighth day he shall take two turtledoves or two pigeons and come before the LORD at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting and give them to the priest.
content_old: 14 On the eighth day he shall take two turtledoves or two pigeons and come before the LORD at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting and give them to the priest.

content: 15 The priest shall offer them, the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering. Thus the priest shall make expiation on his behalf, for his discharge, before the LORD.
content_old: 15 The priest shall offer them, the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering. Thus the priest shall make expiation on his behalf, for his discharge, before the LORD.

content: 16 When a man has an emission of semen, he shall bathe his whole body in water and remain unclean until evening.
content_old: 16 When a man has an emission of semen, he shall bathe his whole body in water and remain unclean until evening.

content: 17 All cloth or leather on which semen falls shall be washed in water and remain unclean until evening.
content_old: 17 All cloth or leather on which semen falls shall be washed in water and remain unclean until evening.

content: 18 And if a man has carnal relations with a woman, they shall bathe in water and remain unclean until evening.
content_old: 18 And if a man has carnal relations with a woman, they shall bathe in water and remain unclean until evening.

content: 19 When a woman has a discharge, her discharge being blood from her body, she shall remain in her impurity seven days; whoever touches her shall be unclean until evening.
content_old: 19 When a woman has a discharge, her discharge being blood from her body, she shall remain in her impurity seven days; whoever touches her shall be unclean until evening.

content: 20 Anything that she lies on during her impurity shall be unclean; and anything that she sits on shall be unclean.
content_old: 20 Anything that she lies on during her impurity shall be unclean; and anything that she sits on shall be unclean.

content: 21 Anyone who touches her bedding shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening;
content_old: 21 Anyone who touches her bedding shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening;

content: 22 and anyone who touches any object on which she has sat shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.
content_old: 22 and anyone who touches any object on which she has sat shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.

content: 23 Be it the bedding or be it the object on which she has sat, on touching it he shall be unclean until evening.
content_old: 23 Be it the bedding or be it the object on which she has sat, on touching it he shall be unclean until evening.

content: 24 And if a man lies with her, her impurity is communicated to him; he shall be unclean seven days, and any bedding on which he lies shall become unclean.
content_old: 24 And if a man lies with her, her impurity is communicated to him; he shall be unclean seven days, and any bedding on which he lies shall become unclean.

content: 25 When a woman has had a discharge of blood for many days, not at the time of her impurity, or when she has a discharge beyond her period of impurity, she shall be unclean, as though at the time of her impurity, as long as her discharge lasts.
content_old: 25 When a woman has had a discharge of blood for many days, not at the time of her impurity, or when she has a discharge beyond her period of impurity, she shall be unclean, as though at the time of her impurity, as long as her discharge lasts.

content: 26 Any bedding on which she lies while her discharge lasts shall be for her like bedding during her impurity; and any object on which she sits shall become unclean, as it does during her impurity:
content_old: 26 Any bedding on which she lies while her discharge lasts shall be for her like bedding during her impurity; and any object on which she sits shall become unclean, as it does during her impurity:

content: 27 whoever touches them shall be unclean; he shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.
content_old: 27 whoever touches them shall be unclean; he shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.

content: 28 When she becomes clean of her discharge, she shall count off seven days, and after that she shall be clean.
content_old: 28 When she becomes clean of her discharge, she shall count off seven days, and after that she shall be clean.

content: 29 On the eighth day she shall take two turtledoves or two pigeons, and bring them to the priest at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 29 On the eighth day she shall take two turtledoves or two pigeons, and bring them to the priest at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

content: 30 The priest shall offer the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering; and the priest shall make expiation on her behalf, for her unclean discharge, before the LORD.
content_old: 30 The priest shall offer the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering; and the priest shall make expiation on her behalf, for her unclean discharge, before the LORD.

content: 31 You shall put the Israelites on guard against their uncleanness, lest they die through their uncleanness by defiling My Tabernacle which is among them.
content_old: 31 You shall put the Israelites on guard against their uncleanness, lest they die through their uncleanness by defiling My Tabernacle which is among them.

content: 32 Such is the ritual concerning him who has a discharge: concerning him who has an emission of semen and becomes unclean thereby,
content_old: 32 Such is the ritual concerning him who has a discharge: concerning him who has an emission of semen and becomes unclean thereby,

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses after the death of the two sons of Aaron who died when they drew too close to the presence of the LORD.
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses after the death of the two sons of Aaron who died when they drew too close to the presence of the LORD.

content: 2 The LORD said to Moses: Tell your brother Aaron that he is not to come at will into the Shrine behind the curtain, in front of the cover that is upon the ark, lest he die; for I appear in the cloud over the cover.
content_old: 2 The LORD said to Moses: Tell your brother Aaron that he is not to come at will into the Shrine behind the curtain, in front of the cover that is upon the ark, lest he die; for I appear in the cloud over the cover.

content: 3 Thus only shall Aaron enter the Shrine: with a bull of the herd for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering.—
content_old: 3 Thus only shall Aaron enter the Shrine: with a bull of the herd for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering.—

content: 4 He shall be dressed in a sacral linen tunic, with linen breeches next to his flesh, and be girt with a linen sash, and he shall wear a linen turban. They are sacral vestments; he shall bathe his body in water and then put them on.—
content_old: 4 He shall be dressed in a sacral linen tunic, with linen breeches next to his flesh, and be girt with a linen sash, and he shall wear a linen turban. They are sacral vestments; he shall bathe his body in water and then put them on.—

content: 5 And from the Israelite community he shall take two he-goats for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering.
content_old: 5 And from the Israelite community he shall take two he-goats for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering.

content: 6 Aaron is to offer his own bull of sin offering, to make expiation for himself and for his household.
content_old: 6 Aaron is to offer his own bull of sin offering, to make expiation for himself and for his household.

content: 7 Aaron shall take the two he-goats and let them stand before the LORD at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting;
content_old: 7 Aaron shall take the two he-goats and let them stand before the LORD at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting;

content: 8 and he shall place lots upon the two goats, one marked for the LORD and the other marked for Azazel.
content_old: 8 and he shall place lots upon the two goats, one marked for the LORD and the other marked for Azazel.

content: 9 Aaron shall bring forward the goat designated by lot for the LORD, which he is to offer as a sin offering;
content_old: 9 Aaron shall bring forward the goat designated by lot for the LORD, which he is to offer as a sin offering;

content: 10 while the goat designated by lot for Azazel shall be left standing alive before the LORD, to make expiation with it and to send it off to the wilderness for Azazel.
content_old: 10 while the goat designated by lot for Azazel shall be left standing alive before the LORD, to make expiation with it and to send it off to the wilderness for Azazel.

content: 11 Aaron shall then offer his bull of sin offering, to make expiation for himself and his household. He shall slaughter his bull of sin offering,
content_old: 11 Aaron shall then offer his bull of sin offering, to make expiation for himself and his household. He shall slaughter his bull of sin offering,

content: 12 and he shall take a panful of glowing coals scooped from the altar before the LORD, and two handfuls of finely ground aromatic incense, and bring this behind the curtain.
content_old: 12 and he shall take a panful of glowing coals scooped from the altar before the LORD, and two handfuls of finely ground aromatic incense, and bring this behind the curtain.

content: 13 He shall put the incense on the fire before the LORD, so that the cloud from the incense screens the cover that is over the Pact, lest he die.
content_old: 13 He shall put the incense on the fire before the LORD, so that the cloud from the incense screens the cover that is over the Pact, lest he die.

content: 14 He shall take some of the blood of the bull and sprinkle it with his finger over the cover on the east side; and in front of the cover he shall sprinkle some of the blood with his finger seven times.
content_old: 14 He shall take some of the blood of the bull and sprinkle it with his finger over the cover on the east side; and in front of the cover he shall sprinkle some of the blood with his finger seven times.

content: 15 He shall then slaughter the people’s goat of sin offering, bring its blood behind the curtain, and do with its blood as he has done with the blood of the bull: he shall sprinkle it over the cover and in front of the cover.
content_old: 15 He shall then slaughter the people’s goat of sin offering, bring its blood behind the curtain, and do with its blood as he has done with the blood of the bull: he shall sprinkle it over the cover and in front of the cover.

content: 16 Thus he shall purge the Shrine of the uncleanness and transgression of the Israelites, whatever their sins; and he shall do the same for the Tent of Meeting, which abides with them in the midst of their uncleanness.
content_old: 16 Thus he shall purge the Shrine of the uncleanness and transgression of the Israelites, whatever their sins; and he shall do the same for the Tent of Meeting, which abides with them in the midst of their uncleanness.

content: 17 When he goes in to make expiation in the Shrine, nobody else shall be in the Tent of Meeting until he comes out. When he has made expiation for himself and his household, and for the whole congregation of Israel,
content_old: 17 When he goes in to make expiation in the Shrine, nobody else shall be in the Tent of Meeting until he comes out. When he has made expiation for himself and his household, and for the whole congregation of Israel,

content: 18 he shall go out to the altar that is before the LORD and purge it: he shall take some of the blood of the bull and of the goat and apply it to each of the horns of the altar;
content_old: 18 he shall go out to the altar that is before the LORD and purge it: he shall take some of the blood of the bull and of the goat and apply it to each of the horns of the altar;

content: 19 and the rest of the blood he shall sprinkle on it with his finger seven times. Thus he shall cleanse it of the uncleanness of the Israelites and consecrate it.
content_old: 19 and the rest of the blood he shall sprinkle on it with his finger seven times. Thus he shall cleanse it of the uncleanness of the Israelites and consecrate it.

content: 20 When he has finished purging the Shrine, the Tent of Meeting, and the altar, the live goat shall be brought forward.
content_old: 20 When he has finished purging the Shrine, the Tent of Meeting, and the altar, the live goat shall be brought forward.

content: 21 Aaron shall lay both his hands upon the head of the live goat and confess over it all the iniquities and transgressions of the Israelites, whatever their sins, putting them on the head of the goat; and it shall be sent off to the wilderness through a designated man.
content_old: 21 Aaron shall lay both his hands upon the head of the live goat and confess over it all the iniquities and transgressions of the Israelites, whatever their sins, putting them on the head of the goat; and it shall be sent off to the wilderness through a designated man.

content: 22 Thus the goat shall carry on it all their iniquities to an inaccessible region; and the goat shall be set free in the wilderness.
content_old: 22 Thus the goat shall carry on it all their iniquities to an inaccessible region; and the goat shall be set free in the wilderness.

content: 23 And Aaron shall go into the Tent of Meeting, take off the linen vestments that he put on when he entered the Shrine, and leave them there.
content_old: 23 And Aaron shall go into the Tent of Meeting, take off the linen vestments that he put on when he entered the Shrine, and leave them there.

content: 24 He shall bathe his body in water in the holy precinct and put on his vestments; then he shall come out and offer his burnt offering and the burnt offering of the people, making expiation for himself and for the people.
content_old: 24 He shall bathe his body in water in the holy precinct and put on his vestments; then he shall come out and offer his burnt offering and the burnt offering of the people, making expiation for himself and for the people.

content: 25 The fat of the sin offering he shall turn into smoke on the altar.
content_old: 25 The fat of the sin offering he shall turn into smoke on the altar.

content: 26 He who set the Azazel-goat free shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water; after that he may reenter the camp.
content_old: 26 He who set the Azazel-goat free shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water; after that he may reenter the camp.

content: 27 The bull of sin offering and the goat of sin offering whose blood was brought in to purge the Shrine shall be taken outside the camp; and their hides, flesh, and dung shall be consumed in fire.
content_old: 27 The bull of sin offering and the goat of sin offering whose blood was brought in to purge the Shrine shall be taken outside the camp; and their hides, flesh, and dung shall be consumed in fire.

content: 28 He who burned them shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water; after that he may re-enter the camp.
content_old: 28 He who burned them shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water; after that he may re-enter the camp.

content: 29 And this shall be to you a law for all time: In the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, you shall practice self-denial; and you shall do no manner of work, neither the citizen nor the alien who resides among you.
content_old: 29 And this shall be to you a law for all time: In the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, you shall practice self-denial; and you shall do no manner of work, neither the citizen nor the alien who resides among you.

content: 30 For on this day atonement shall be made for you to cleanse you of all your sins; you shall be clean before the LORD.
content_old: 30 For on this day atonement shall be made for you to cleanse you of all your sins; you shall be clean before the LORD.

content: 31 It shall be a sabbath of complete rest for you, and you shall practice self-denial; it is a law for all time.
content_old: 31 It shall be a sabbath of complete rest for you, and you shall practice self-denial; it is a law for all time.

content: 32 The priest who has been anointed and ordained to serve as priest in place of his father shall make expiation. He shall put on the linen vestments, the sacral vestments.
content_old: 32 The priest who has been anointed and ordained to serve as priest in place of his father shall make expiation. He shall put on the linen vestments, the sacral vestments.

content: 33 He shall purge the innermost Shrine; he shall purge the Tent of Meeting and the altar; and he shall make expiation for the priests and for all the people of the congregation.
content_old: 33 He shall purge the innermost Shrine; he shall purge the Tent of Meeting and the altar; and he shall make expiation for the priests and for all the people of the congregation.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 Speak to Aaron and his sons and to all the Israelite people and say to them: This is what the LORD has commanded:
content_old: 2 Speak to Aaron and his sons and to all the Israelite people and say to them: This is what the LORD has commanded:

content: 3 if anyone of the house of Israel slaughters an ox or sheep or goat in the camp, or does so outside the camp,
content_old: 3 if anyone of the house of Israel slaughters an ox or sheep or goat in the camp, or does so outside the camp,

content: 4 and does not bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting to present it as an offering to the LORD, before the LORD’s Tabernacle, bloodguilt shall be imputed to that man: he has shed blood; that man shall be cut off from among his people.
content_old: 4 and does not bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting to present it as an offering to the LORD, before the LORD’s Tabernacle, bloodguilt shall be imputed to that man: he has shed blood; that man shall be cut off from among his people.

content: 5 This is in order that the Israelites may bring the sacrifices which they have been making in the open—that they may bring them before the LORD, to the priest, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and offer them as sacrifices of well-being to the LORD;
content_old: 5 This is in order that the Israelites may bring the sacrifices which they have been making in the open—that they may bring them before the LORD, to the priest, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and offer them as sacrifices of well-being to the LORD;

content: 6 that the priest may dash the blood against the altar of the LORD at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and turn the fat into smoke as a pleasing odor to the LORD;
content_old: 6 that the priest may dash the blood against the altar of the LORD at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and turn the fat into smoke as a pleasing odor to the LORD;

content: 7 and that they may offer their sacrifices no more to the goat-demons after whom they stray. This shall be to them a law for all time, throughout the ages.
content_old: 7 and that they may offer their sacrifices no more to the goat-demons after whom they stray. This shall be to them a law for all time, throughout the ages.

content: 8 Say to them further: If anyone of the house of Israel or of the strangers who reside among them offers a burnt offering or a sacrifice,
content_old: 8 Say to them further: If anyone of the house of Israel or of the strangers who reside among them offers a burnt offering or a sacrifice,

content: 9 and does not bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting to offer it to the LORD, that person shall be cut off from his people.
content_old: 9 and does not bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting to offer it to the LORD, that person shall be cut off from his people.

content: 10 And if anyone of the house of Israel or of the strangers who reside among them partakes of any blood, I will set My face against the person who partakes of the blood, and I will cut him off from among his kin.
content_old: 10 And if anyone of the house of Israel or of the strangers who reside among them partakes of any blood, I will set My face against the person who partakes of the blood, and I will cut him off from among his kin.

content: 11 For the life of the flesh is in the blood, and I have assigned it to you for making expiation for your lives upon the altar; it is the blood, as life, that effects expiation.
content_old: 11 For the life of the flesh is in the blood, and I have assigned it to you for making expiation for your lives upon the altar; it is the blood, as life, that effects expiation.

content: 12 Therefore I say to the Israelite people: No person among you shall partake of blood, nor shall the stranger who resides among you partake of blood.
content_old: 12 Therefore I say to the Israelite people: No person among you shall partake of blood, nor shall the stranger who resides among you partake of blood.

content: 13 And if any Israelite or any stranger who resides among them hunts down an animal or a bird that may be eaten, he shall pour out its blood and cover it with earth.
content_old: 13 And if any Israelite or any stranger who resides among them hunts down an animal or a bird that may be eaten, he shall pour out its blood and cover it with earth.

content: 14 For the life of all flesh—its blood is its life. Therefore I say to the Israelite people: You shall not partake of the blood of any flesh, for the life of all flesh is its blood. Anyone who partakes of it shall be cut off.
content_old: 14 For the life of all flesh—its blood is its life. Therefore I say to the Israelite people: You shall not partake of the blood of any flesh, for the life of all flesh is its blood. Anyone who partakes of it shall be cut off.

content: 15 Any person, whether citizen or stranger, who eats what has died or has been torn by beasts shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening; then he shall be clean.
content_old: 15 Any person, whether citizen or stranger, who eats what has died or has been torn by beasts shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening; then he shall be clean.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: I the LORD am your God.
content_old: 2 Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: I the LORD am your God.

content: 3 You shall not copy the practices of the land of Egypt where you dwelt, or of the land of Canaan to which I am taking you; nor shall you follow their laws.
content_old: 3 You shall not copy the practices of the land of Egypt where you dwelt, or of the land of Canaan to which I am taking you; nor shall you follow their laws.

content: 4 My rules alone shall you observe, and faithfully follow My laws: I the LORD am your God.
content_old: 4 My rules alone shall you observe, and faithfully follow My laws: I the LORD am your God.

content: 5 You shall keep My laws and My rules, by the pursuit of which man shall live: I am the LORD.
content_old: 5 You shall keep My laws and My rules, by the pursuit of which man shall live: I am the LORD.

content: 6 None of you shall come near anyone of his own flesh to uncover nakedness: I am the LORD.
content_old: 6 None of you shall come near anyone of his own flesh to uncover nakedness: I am the LORD.

content: 7 Your father’s nakedness, that is, the nakedness of your mother, you shall not uncover; she is your mother—you shall not uncover her nakedness.
content_old: 7 Your father’s nakedness, that is, the nakedness of your mother, you shall not uncover; she is your mother—you shall not uncover her nakedness.

content: 8 Do not uncover the nakedness of your father’s wife; it is the nakedness of your father.
content_old: 8 Do not uncover the nakedness of your father’s wife; it is the nakedness of your father.

content: 9 The nakedness of your sister—your father’s daughter or your mother’s, whether born into the household or outside—do not uncover their nakedness.
content_old: 9 The nakedness of your sister—your father’s daughter or your mother’s, whether born into the household or outside—do not uncover their nakedness.

content: 10 The nakedness of your son’s daughter, or of your daughter’s daughter—do not uncover their nakedness; for their nakedness is yours.
content_old: 10 The nakedness of your son’s daughter, or of your daughter’s daughter—do not uncover their nakedness; for their nakedness is yours.

content: 11 The nakedness of your father’s wife’s daughter, who has born into your father’s household—she is your sister; do not uncover her nakedness.
content_old: 11 The nakedness of your father’s wife’s daughter, who has born into your father’s household—she is your sister; do not uncover her nakedness.

content: 12 Do not uncover the nakedness of your father’s sister; she is your father’s flesh.
content_old: 12 Do not uncover the nakedness of your father’s sister; she is your father’s flesh.

content: 13 Do not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister; for she is your mother’s flesh.
content_old: 13 Do not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister; for she is your mother’s flesh.

content: 14 Do not uncover the nakedness of your father’s brother: do not approach his wife; she is your aunt.
content_old: 14 Do not uncover the nakedness of your father’s brother: do not approach his wife; she is your aunt.

content: 15 Do not uncover the nakedness of your daughter-in-law: she is your son’s wife; you shall not uncover her nakedness.
content_old: 15 Do not uncover the nakedness of your daughter-in-law: she is your son’s wife; you shall not uncover her nakedness.

content: 16 Do not uncover the nakedness of your brother’s wife; it is the nakedness of your brother.
content_old: 16 Do not uncover the nakedness of your brother’s wife; it is the nakedness of your brother.

content: 17 Do not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter; nor shall you marry her son’s daughter or her daughter’s daughter and uncover her nakedness: they are kindred; it is depravity.
content_old: 17 Do not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter; nor shall you marry her son’s daughter or her daughter’s daughter and uncover her nakedness: they are kindred; it is depravity.

content: 18 Do not marry a woman as a rival to her sister and uncover her nakedness in the other’s lifetime.
content_old: 18 Do not marry a woman as a rival to her sister and uncover her nakedness in the other’s lifetime.

content: 19 Do not come near a woman during her period of uncleanness to uncover her nakedness.
content_old: 19 Do not come near a woman during her period of uncleanness to uncover her nakedness.

content: 20 Do not have carnal relations with your neighbor’s wife and defile yourself with her.
content_old: 20 Do not have carnal relations with your neighbor’s wife and defile yourself with her.

content: 21 Do not allow any of your offspring to be offered up to Molech, and do not profane the name of your God: I am the LORD.
content_old: 21 Do not allow any of your offspring to be offered up to Molech, and do not profane the name of your God: I am the LORD.

content: 22 Do not lie with a male as one lies with a woman; it is an abhorrence.
content_old: 22 Do not lie with a male as one lies with a woman; it is an abhorrence.
