content: 23 Do not have carnal relations with any beast and defile yourself thereby; and let no woman lend herself to a beast to mate with it; it is perversion.
content_old: 23 Do not have carnal relations with any beast and defile yourself thereby; and let no woman lend herself to a beast to mate with it; it is perversion.

content: 24 Do not defile yourselves in any of those ways, for it is by such that the nations that I am casting out before you defiled themselves.
content_old: 24 Do not defile yourselves in any of those ways, for it is by such that the nations that I am casting out before you defiled themselves.

content: 25 Thus the land became defiled; and I called it to account for its iniquity, and the land spewed out its inhabitants.
content_old: 25 Thus the land became defiled; and I called it to account for its iniquity, and the land spewed out its inhabitants.

content: 26 But you must keep My laws and My rules, and you must not do any of those abhorrent things, neither the citizen nor the stranger who resides among you;
content_old: 26 But you must keep My laws and My rules, and you must not do any of those abhorrent things, neither the citizen nor the stranger who resides among you;

content: 27 for all those abhorrent things were done by the people who were in the land before you, and the land became defiled.
content_old: 27 for all those abhorrent things were done by the people who were in the land before you, and the land became defiled.

content: 28 So let not the land spew you out for defiling it, as it spewed out the nation that came before you.
content_old: 28 So let not the land spew you out for defiling it, as it spewed out the nation that came before you.

content: 29 All who do any of those abhorrent things—such persons shall be cut off from their people.
content_old: 29 All who do any of those abhorrent things—such persons shall be cut off from their people.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 Speak to the whole Israelite community and say to them: You shall be holy, for I, the LORD your God, am holy.
content_old: 2 Speak to the whole Israelite community and say to them: You shall be holy, for I, the LORD your God, am holy.

content: 3 You shall each revere his mother and his father, and keep My sabbaths: I the LORD am your God.
content_old: 3 You shall each revere his mother and his father, and keep My sabbaths: I the LORD am your God.

content: 4 Do not turn to idols or make molten gods for yourselves: I the LORD am your God.
content_old: 4 Do not turn to idols or make molten gods for yourselves: I the LORD am your God.

content: 5 When you sacrifice an offering of well-being to the LORD, sacrifice it so that it may be accepted on your behalf.
content_old: 5 When you sacrifice an offering of well-being to the LORD, sacrifice it so that it may be accepted on your behalf.

content: 6 It shall be eaten on the day you sacrifice it, or on the day following; but what is left by the third day must be consumed in fire.
content_old: 6 It shall be eaten on the day you sacrifice it, or on the day following; but what is left by the third day must be consumed in fire.

content: 7 If it should be eaten on the third day, it is an offensive thing, it will not be acceptable.
content_old: 7 If it should be eaten on the third day, it is an offensive thing, it will not be acceptable.

content: 8 And he who eats of it shall bear his guilt, for he has profaned what is sacred to the LORD; that person shall be cut off from his kin.
content_old: 8 And he who eats of it shall bear his guilt, for he has profaned what is sacred to the LORD; that person shall be cut off from his kin.

content: 9 When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not reap all the way to the edges of your field, or gather the gleanings of your harvest.
content_old: 9 When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not reap all the way to the edges of your field, or gather the gleanings of your harvest.

content: 10 You shall not pick your vineyard bare, or gather the fallen fruit of your vineyard; you shall leave them for the poor and the stranger: I the LORD am your God.
content_old: 10 You shall not pick your vineyard bare, or gather the fallen fruit of your vineyard; you shall leave them for the poor and the stranger: I the LORD am your God.

content: 11 You shall not steal; you shall not deal deceitfully or falsely with one another.
content_old: 11 You shall not steal; you shall not deal deceitfully or falsely with one another.

content: 12 You shall not swear falsely by My name, profaning the name of your God: I am the LORD.
content_old: 12 You shall not swear falsely by My name, profaning the name of your God: I am the LORD.

content: 13 You shall not defraud your fellow. You shall not commit robbery. The wages of a laborer shall not remain with you until morning.
content_old: 13 You shall not defraud your fellow. You shall not commit robbery. The wages of a laborer shall not remain with you until morning.

content: 14 You shall not insult the deaf, or place a stumbling block before the blind. You shall fear your God: I am the LORD.
content_old: 14 You shall not insult the deaf, or place a stumbling block before the blind. You shall fear your God: I am the LORD.

content: 15 You shall not render an unfair decision: do not favor the poor or show deference to the rich; judge your kinsman fairly.
content_old: 15 You shall not render an unfair decision: do not favor the poor or show deference to the rich; judge your kinsman fairly.

content: 16 Do not deal basely with your countrymen. Do not profit by the blood of your fellow: I am the LORD.
content_old: 16 Do not deal basely with your countrymen. Do not profit by the blood of your fellow: I am the LORD.

content: 17 You shall not hate your kinsfolk in your heart. Reprove your kinsman but incur no guilt because of him.
content_old: 17 You shall not hate your kinsfolk in your heart. Reprove your kinsman but incur no guilt because of him.

content: 18 You shall not take vengeance or bear a grudge against your countrymen. Love your fellow as yourself: I am the LORD.
content_old: 18 You shall not take vengeance or bear a grudge against your countrymen. Love your fellow as yourself: I am the LORD.

content: 19 You shall observe My laws. You shall not let your cattle mate with a different kind; you shall not sow your field with two kinds of seed; you shall not put on cloth from a mixture of two kinds of material.
content_old: 19 You shall observe My laws. You shall not let your cattle mate with a different kind; you shall not sow your field with two kinds of seed; you shall not put on cloth from a mixture of two kinds of material.

content: 20 If a man has carnal relations with a woman who is a slave and has been designated for another man, but has not been redeemed or given her freedom, there shall be an indemnity; they shall not, however, be put to death, since she has not been freed.
content_old: 20 If a man has carnal relations with a woman who is a slave and has been designated for another man, but has not been redeemed or given her freedom, there shall be an indemnity; they shall not, however, be put to death, since she has not been freed.

content: 21 But he must bring to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, as his guilt offering to the LORD, a ram of guilt offering.
content_old: 21 But he must bring to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, as his guilt offering to the LORD, a ram of guilt offering.

content: 22 With the ram of guilt offering the priest shall make expiation for him before the LORD for the sin that he committed; and the sin that he committed will be forgiven him.
content_old: 22 With the ram of guilt offering the priest shall make expiation for him before the LORD for the sin that he committed; and the sin that he committed will be forgiven him.

content: 23 When you enter the land and plant any tree for food, you shall regard its fruit as forbidden. Three years it shall be forbidden for you, not to be eaten.
content_old: 23 When you enter the land and plant any tree for food, you shall regard its fruit as forbidden. Three years it shall be forbidden for you, not to be eaten.

content: 24 In the fourth year all its fruit shall be set aside for jubilation before the LORD;
content_old: 24 In the fourth year all its fruit shall be set aside for jubilation before the LORD;

content: 25 and only in the fifth year may you use its fruit—that its yield to you may be increased: I the LORD am your God.
content_old: 25 and only in the fifth year may you use its fruit—that its yield to you may be increased: I the LORD am your God.

content: 26 You shall not eat anything with its blood. You shall not practice divination or soothsaying.
content_old: 26 You shall not eat anything with its blood. You shall not practice divination or soothsaying.

content: 27 You shall not round off the side-growth on your head, or destroy the side-growth of your beard.
content_old: 27 You shall not round off the side-growth on your head, or destroy the side-growth of your beard.

content: 28 You shall not make gashes in your flesh for the dead, or incise any marks on yourselves: I am the LORD.
content_old: 28 You shall not make gashes in your flesh for the dead, or incise any marks on yourselves: I am the LORD.

content: 29 Do not degrade your daughter and make her a harlot, lest the land fall into harlotry and the land be filled with depravity.
content_old: 29 Do not degrade your daughter and make her a harlot, lest the land fall into harlotry and the land be filled with depravity.

content: 30 You shall keep My sabbaths and venerate My sanctuary: I am the LORD.
content_old: 30 You shall keep My sabbaths and venerate My sanctuary: I am the LORD.

content: 31 Do not turn to ghosts and do not inquire of familiar spirits, to be defiled by them: I the LORD am your God.
content_old: 31 Do not turn to ghosts and do not inquire of familiar spirits, to be defiled by them: I the LORD am your God.

content: 32 You shall rise before the aged and show deference to the old; you shall fear your God: I am the LORD.
content_old: 32 You shall rise before the aged and show deference to the old; you shall fear your God: I am the LORD.

content: 33 When a stranger resides with you in your land, you shall not wrong him.
content_old: 33 When a stranger resides with you in your land, you shall not wrong him.

content: 34 The stranger who resides with you shall be to you as one of your citizens; you shall love him as yourself, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt: I the LORD am your God.
content_old: 34 The stranger who resides with you shall be to you as one of your citizens; you shall love him as yourself, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt: I the LORD am your God.

content: 35 You shall not falsify measures of length, weight, or capacity.
content_old: 35 You shall not falsify measures of length, weight, or capacity.

content: 36 You shall have an honest balance, honest weights, an honest ephah, and an honest hin. I the LORD am your God who freed you from the land of Egypt.
content_old: 36 You shall have an honest balance, honest weights, an honest ephah, and an honest hin. I the LORD am your God who freed you from the land of Egypt.

content: 1 And the LORD spoke to Moses:
content_old: 1 And the LORD spoke to Moses:

content: 2 Say further to the Israelite people: Anyone among the Israelites, or among the strangers residing in Israel, who gives any of his offspring to Molech, shall be put to death; the people of the land shall pelt him with stones.
content_old: 2 Say further to the Israelite people: Anyone among the Israelites, or among the strangers residing in Israel, who gives any of his offspring to Molech, shall be put to death; the people of the land shall pelt him with stones.

content: 3 And I will set My face against that man and will cut him off from among his people, because he gave of his offspring to Molech and so defiled My sanctuary and profaned My holy name.
content_old: 3 And I will set My face against that man and will cut him off from among his people, because he gave of his offspring to Molech and so defiled My sanctuary and profaned My holy name.

content: 4 And if the people of the land should shut their eyes to that man when he gives of his offspring to Molech, and should not put him to death,
content_old: 4 And if the people of the land should shut their eyes to that man when he gives of his offspring to Molech, and should not put him to death,

content: 5 I Myself will set My face against that man and his kin, and will cut off from among their people both him and all who follow him in going astray after Molech.
content_old: 5 I Myself will set My face against that man and his kin, and will cut off from among their people both him and all who follow him in going astray after Molech.

content: 6 And if any person turns to ghosts and familiar spirits and goes astray after them, I will set My face against that person and cut him off from among his people.
content_old: 6 And if any person turns to ghosts and familiar spirits and goes astray after them, I will set My face against that person and cut him off from among his people.

content: 7 You shall sanctify yourselves and be holy, for I the LORD am your God.
content_old: 7 You shall sanctify yourselves and be holy, for I the LORD am your God.

content: 8 You shall faithfully observe My laws: I the LORD make you holy.
content_old: 8 You shall faithfully observe My laws: I the LORD make you holy.

content: 9 If anyone insults his father or his mother, he shall be put to death; he has insulted his father and his mother—his bloodguilt is upon him.
content_old: 9 If anyone insults his father or his mother, he shall be put to death; he has insulted his father and his mother—his bloodguilt is upon him.

content: 10 If a man commits adultery with a married woman, committing adultery with another man’s wife, the adulterer and the adulteress shall be put to death.
content_old: 10 If a man commits adultery with a married woman, committing adultery with another man’s wife, the adulterer and the adulteress shall be put to death.

content: 11 If a man lies with his father’s wife, it is the nakedness of his father that he has uncovered; the two shall be put to death—their bloodguilt is upon them.
content_old: 11 If a man lies with his father’s wife, it is the nakedness of his father that he has uncovered; the two shall be put to death—their bloodguilt is upon them.

content: 12 If a man lies with his daughter-in-law, both of them shall be put to death; they have committed incest—their bloodguilt is upon them.
content_old: 12 If a man lies with his daughter-in-law, both of them shall be put to death; they have committed incest—their bloodguilt is upon them.

content: 13 If a man lies with a male as one lies with a woman, the two of them have done an abhorrent thing; they shall be put to death—their bloodguilt is upon them.
content_old: 13 If a man lies with a male as one lies with a woman, the two of them have done an abhorrent thing; they shall be put to death—their bloodguilt is upon them.

content: 14 If a man marries a woman and her mother, it is depravity; both he and they shall be put to the fire, that there be no depravity among you.
content_old: 14 If a man marries a woman and her mother, it is depravity; both he and they shall be put to the fire, that there be no depravity among you.

content: 15 If a man has carnal relations with a beast, he shall be put to death; and you shall kill the beast.
content_old: 15 If a man has carnal relations with a beast, he shall be put to death; and you shall kill the beast.

content: 16 If a woman approaches any beast to mate with it, you shall kill the woman and the beast; they shall be put to death—their bloodguilt is upon them.
content_old: 16 If a woman approaches any beast to mate with it, you shall kill the woman and the beast; they shall be put to death—their bloodguilt is upon them.

content: 17 If a man marries his sister, the daughter of either his father or his mother, so that he sees her nakedness and she sees his nakedness, it is a disgrace; they shall be excommunicated in the sight of their kinsfolk. He has uncovered the nakedness of his sister, he shall bear his guilt.
content_old: 17 If a man marries his sister, the daughter of either his father or his mother, so that he sees her nakedness and she sees his nakedness, it is a disgrace; they shall be excommunicated in the sight of their kinsfolk. He has uncovered the nakedness of his sister, he shall bear his guilt.

content: 18 If a man lies with a woman in her infirmity and uncovers her nakedness, he has laid bare her flow and she has exposed her blood flow; both of them shall be cut off from among their people.
content_old: 18 If a man lies with a woman in her infirmity and uncovers her nakedness, he has laid bare her flow and she has exposed her blood flow; both of them shall be cut off from among their people.

content: 19 You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister or of your father’s sister, for that is laying bare one’s own flesh; they shall bear their guilt.
content_old: 19 You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister or of your father’s sister, for that is laying bare one’s own flesh; they shall bear their guilt.

content: 20 If a man lies with his uncle’s wife, it is his uncle’s nakedness that he has uncovered. They shall bear their guilt: they shall die childless.
content_old: 20 If a man lies with his uncle’s wife, it is his uncle’s nakedness that he has uncovered. They shall bear their guilt: they shall die childless.

content: 21 If a man marries the wife of his brother, it is indecency. It is the nakedness of his brother that he has uncovered; they shall remain childless.
content_old: 21 If a man marries the wife of his brother, it is indecency. It is the nakedness of his brother that he has uncovered; they shall remain childless.

content: 22 You shall faithfully observe all My laws and all My regulations, lest the land to which I bring you to settle in spew you out.
content_old: 22 You shall faithfully observe all My laws and all My regulations, lest the land to which I bring you to settle in spew you out.

content: 23 You shall not follow the practices of the nation that I am driving out before you. For it is because they did all these things that I abhorred them
content_old: 23 You shall not follow the practices of the nation that I am driving out before you. For it is because they did all these things that I abhorred them

content: 24 and said to you: You shall possess their land, for I will give it to you to possess, a land flowing with milk and honey. I the LORD am your God who has set you apart from other peoples.
content_old: 24 and said to you: You shall possess their land, for I will give it to you to possess, a land flowing with milk and honey. I the LORD am your God who has set you apart from other peoples.

content: 25 So you shall set apart the clean beast from the unclean, the unclean bird from the clean. You shall not draw abomination upon yourselves through beast or bird or anything with which the ground is alive, which I have set apart for you to treat as unclean.
content_old: 25 So you shall set apart the clean beast from the unclean, the unclean bird from the clean. You shall not draw abomination upon yourselves through beast or bird or anything with which the ground is alive, which I have set apart for you to treat as unclean.

content: 26 You shall be holy to Me, for I the LORD am holy, and I have set you apart from other peoples to be Mine.
content_old: 26 You shall be holy to Me, for I the LORD am holy, and I have set you apart from other peoples to be Mine.

content: 1 The LORD said to Moses: Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and say to them: None shall defile himself for any dead person among his kin,
content_old: 1 The LORD said to Moses: Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and say to them: None shall defile himself for any dead person among his kin,

content: 2 except for the relatives that are closest to him: his mother, his father, his son, his daughter, and his brother;
content_old: 2 except for the relatives that are closest to him: his mother, his father, his son, his daughter, and his brother;

content: 3 also for a virgin sister, close to him because she has not married, for her he may defile himself.
content_old: 3 also for a virgin sister, close to him because she has not married, for her he may defile himself.

content: 4 But he shall not defile himself as a kinsman by marriage, and so profane himself.
content_old: 4 But he shall not defile himself as a kinsman by marriage, and so profane himself.

content: 5 They shall not shave smooth any part of their heads, or cut the side-growth of their beards, or make gashes in their flesh.
content_old: 5 They shall not shave smooth any part of their heads, or cut the side-growth of their beards, or make gashes in their flesh.

content: 6 They shall be holy to their God and not profane the name of their God; for they offer the LORD’s offerings by fire, the food of their God, and so must be holy.
content_old: 6 They shall be holy to their God and not profane the name of their God; for they offer the LORD’s offerings by fire, the food of their God, and so must be holy.

content: 7 They shall not marry a woman defiled by harlotry, nor shall they marry one divorced from her husband. For they are holy to their God
content_old: 7 They shall not marry a woman defiled by harlotry, nor shall they marry one divorced from her husband. For they are holy to their God

content: 8 and you must treat them as holy, since they offer the food of your God; they shall be holy to you, for I the LORD who sanctify you am holy.
content_old: 8 and you must treat them as holy, since they offer the food of your God; they shall be holy to you, for I the LORD who sanctify you am holy.

content: 9 When the daughter of a priest defiles herself through harlotry, it is her father whom she defiles; she shall be put to the fire.
content_old: 9 When the daughter of a priest defiles herself through harlotry, it is her father whom she defiles; she shall be put to the fire.

content: 10 The priest who is exalted above his fellows, on whose head the anointing oil has been poured and who has been ordained to wear the vestments, shall not bare his head or rend his vestments.
content_old: 10 The priest who is exalted above his fellows, on whose head the anointing oil has been poured and who has been ordained to wear the vestments, shall not bare his head or rend his vestments.

content: 11 He shall not go in where there is any dead body; he shall not defile himself even for his father or mother.
content_old: 11 He shall not go in where there is any dead body; he shall not defile himself even for his father or mother.

content: 12 He shall not go outside the sanctuary and profane the sanctuary of his God, for upon him is the distinction of the anointing oil of his God, Mine the LORD’s.
content_old: 12 He shall not go outside the sanctuary and profane the sanctuary of his God, for upon him is the distinction of the anointing oil of his God, Mine the LORD’s.

content: 13 He may marry only a woman who is a virgin.
content_old: 13 He may marry only a woman who is a virgin.

content: 14 A widow, or a divorced woman, or one who is degraded by harlotry—such he may not marry. Only a virgin of his own kin may he take to wife—
content_old: 14 A widow, or a divorced woman, or one who is degraded by harlotry—such he may not marry. Only a virgin of his own kin may he take to wife—

content: 15 that he may not profane his offspring among his kin, for I the LORD have sanctified him.
content_old: 15 that he may not profane his offspring among his kin, for I the LORD have sanctified him.

content: 16 The LORD spoke further to Moses:
content_old: 16 The LORD spoke further to Moses:

content: 17 Speak to Aaron and say: No man of your offspring throughout the ages who has a defect shall be qualified to offer the food of his God.
content_old: 17 Speak to Aaron and say: No man of your offspring throughout the ages who has a defect shall be qualified to offer the food of his God.

content: 18 No one at all who has a defect shall be qualified: no man who is blind, or lame, or has a limb too short or too long;
content_old: 18 No one at all who has a defect shall be qualified: no man who is blind, or lame, or has a limb too short or too long;

content: 19 no man who has a broken leg or a broken arm;
content_old: 19 no man who has a broken leg or a broken arm;

content: 20 or who is a hunchback, or a dwarf, or who has a growth in his eye, or who has a boil-scar, or scurvy, or crushed testes.
content_old: 20 or who is a hunchback, or a dwarf, or who has a growth in his eye, or who has a boil-scar, or scurvy, or crushed testes.

content: 21 No man among the offspring of Aaron the priest who has a defect shall be qualified to offer the LORD’s offering by fire; having a defect, he shall not be qualified to offer the food of his God.
content_old: 21 No man among the offspring of Aaron the priest who has a defect shall be qualified to offer the LORD’s offering by fire; having a defect, he shall not be qualified to offer the food of his God.

content: 22 He may eat of the food of his God, of the most holy as well as of the holy;
content_old: 22 He may eat of the food of his God, of the most holy as well as of the holy;

content: 23 but he shall not enter behind the curtain or come near the altar, for he has a defect. He shall not profane these places sacred to Me, for I the LORD have sanctified them.
content_old: 23 but he shall not enter behind the curtain or come near the altar, for he has a defect. He shall not profane these places sacred to Me, for I the LORD have sanctified them.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 Instruct Aaron and his sons to be scrupulous about the sacred donations that the Israelite people consecrate to Me, lest they profane My holy name, Mine the LORD’s.
content_old: 2 Instruct Aaron and his sons to be scrupulous about the sacred donations that the Israelite people consecrate to Me, lest they profane My holy name, Mine the LORD’s.

content: 3 Say to them: Throughout the ages, if any man among your offspring, while in a state of uncleanness, partakes of any sacred donation that the Israelite people may consecrate to the LORD, that person shall be cut off from before Me: I am the LORD.
content_old: 3 Say to them: Throughout the ages, if any man among your offspring, while in a state of uncleanness, partakes of any sacred donation that the Israelite people may consecrate to the LORD, that person shall be cut off from before Me: I am the LORD.

content: 4 No man of Aaron’s offspring who has an eruption or a discharge shall eat of the sacred donations until he is clean. If one touches anything made unclean by a corpse, or if a man has an emission of semen,
content_old: 4 No man of Aaron’s offspring who has an eruption or a discharge shall eat of the sacred donations until he is clean. If one touches anything made unclean by a corpse, or if a man has an emission of semen,

content: 5 or if a man touches any swarming thing by which he is made unclean or any human being by whom he is made unclean—whatever his uncleanness—
content_old: 5 or if a man touches any swarming thing by which he is made unclean or any human being by whom he is made unclean—whatever his uncleanness—

content: 6 the person who touches such shall be unclean until evening and shall not eat of the sacred donations unless he has washed his body in water.
content_old: 6 the person who touches such shall be unclean until evening and shall not eat of the sacred donations unless he has washed his body in water.

content: 7 As soon as the sun sets, he shall be clean; and afterward he may eat of the sacred donations, for they are his food.
content_old: 7 As soon as the sun sets, he shall be clean; and afterward he may eat of the sacred donations, for they are his food.

content: 8 He shall not eat anything that died or was torn by beasts, thereby becoming unclean: I am the LORD.
content_old: 8 He shall not eat anything that died or was torn by beasts, thereby becoming unclean: I am the LORD.

content: 9 They shall keep My charge, lest they incur guilt thereby and die for it, having committed profanation: I the LORD consecrate them.
content_old: 9 They shall keep My charge, lest they incur guilt thereby and die for it, having committed profanation: I the LORD consecrate them.

content: 10 No lay person shall eat of the sacred donations. No bound or hired laborer of a priest shall eat of the sacred donations;
content_old: 10 No lay person shall eat of the sacred donations. No bound or hired laborer of a priest shall eat of the sacred donations;

content: 11 but a person who is a priest’s property by purchase may eat of them; and those that are born into his household may eat of his food.
content_old: 11 but a person who is a priest’s property by purchase may eat of them; and those that are born into his household may eat of his food.

content: 12 If a priest’s daughter marries a layman, she may not eat of the sacred gifts;
content_old: 12 If a priest’s daughter marries a layman, she may not eat of the sacred gifts;

content: 13 but if the priest’s daughter is widowed or divorced and without offspring, and is back in her father’s house as in her youth, she may eat of her father’s food. No lay person may eat of it:
content_old: 13 but if the priest’s daughter is widowed or divorced and without offspring, and is back in her father’s house as in her youth, she may eat of her father’s food. No lay person may eat of it:

content: 14 but if a man eats of a sacred donation unwittingly, he shall pay the priest for the sacred donation, adding one-fifth of its value.
content_old: 14 but if a man eats of a sacred donation unwittingly, he shall pay the priest for the sacred donation, adding one-fifth of its value.

content: 15 But must not allow the Israelites to profane the sacred donations that they set aside for the LORD,
content_old: 15 But must not allow the Israelites to profane the sacred donations that they set aside for the LORD,

content: 16 or to incur guilt requiring a penalty payment, by eating such sacred donations: for it is I the LORD who make them sacred.
content_old: 16 or to incur guilt requiring a penalty payment, by eating such sacred donations: for it is I the LORD who make them sacred.

content: 17 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 17 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 18 Speak to Aaron and his sons, and to all the Israelite people, and say to them: When any man of the house of Israel or of the strangers in Israel presents a burnt offering as his offering for any of the votive or any of the freewill offerings that they offer to the LORD,
content_old: 18 Speak to Aaron and his sons, and to all the Israelite people, and say to them: When any man of the house of Israel or of the strangers in Israel presents a burnt offering as his offering for any of the votive or any of the freewill offerings that they offer to the LORD,

content: 19 it must, to be acceptable in your favor, be a male without blemish, from cattle or sheep or goats.
content_old: 19 it must, to be acceptable in your favor, be a male without blemish, from cattle or sheep or goats.

content: 20 You shall not offer any that has a defect, for it will not be accepted in your favor.
content_old: 20 You shall not offer any that has a defect, for it will not be accepted in your favor.

content: 21 And when a man offers, from the herd or the flock, a sacrifice of well-being to the LORD for an explicit vow or as a freewill offering, it must, to be acceptable, be without blemish; there must be no defect in it.
content_old: 21 And when a man offers, from the herd or the flock, a sacrifice of well-being to the LORD for an explicit vow or as a freewill offering, it must, to be acceptable, be without blemish; there must be no defect in it.

content: 22 Anything blind, or injured, or maimed, or with a wen, boil-scar, or scurvy—such you shall not offer to the LORD; you shall not put any of them on the altar as offerings by fire to the LORD.
content_old: 22 Anything blind, or injured, or maimed, or with a wen, boil-scar, or scurvy—such you shall not offer to the LORD; you shall not put any of them on the altar as offerings by fire to the LORD.

content: 23 You may, however, present as a freewill offering an ox or a sheep with a limb extended or contracted; but it will not be accepted for a vow.
content_old: 23 You may, however, present as a freewill offering an ox or a sheep with a limb extended or contracted; but it will not be accepted for a vow.

content: 24 You shall not offer to the LORD anything with its testesbruised or crushed or torn or cut. You shall have no such practices in your own land,
content_old: 24 You shall not offer to the LORD anything with its testesbruised or crushed or torn or cut. You shall have no such practices in your own land,

content: 25 nor shall you accept such animals from a foreigner for offering as food for your God, for they are mutilated, they have a defect; they shall not be accepted in your favor.
content_old: 25 nor shall you accept such animals from a foreigner for offering as food for your God, for they are mutilated, they have a defect; they shall not be accepted in your favor.

content: 26 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 26 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 27 When an ox or a sheep or a goat is born, it shall stay seven days with its mother, and from the eighth day on it shall be acceptable as an offering by fire to the LORD.
content_old: 27 When an ox or a sheep or a goat is born, it shall stay seven days with its mother, and from the eighth day on it shall be acceptable as an offering by fire to the LORD.

content: 28 However, no animal from the herd or from the flock shall be slaughtered on the same day with its young.
content_old: 28 However, no animal from the herd or from the flock shall be slaughtered on the same day with its young.

content: 29 When you sacrifice a thanksgiving offering to the LORD, sacrifice it so that it may be acceptable in your favor.
content_old: 29 When you sacrifice a thanksgiving offering to the LORD, sacrifice it so that it may be acceptable in your favor.

content: 30 It shall be eaten on the same day; you shall not leave any of it until morning: I am the LORD.
content_old: 30 It shall be eaten on the same day; you shall not leave any of it until morning: I am the LORD.

content: 31 You shall faithfully observe My commandments: I am the LORD.
content_old: 31 You shall faithfully observe My commandments: I am the LORD.

content: 32 You shall not profane My holy name, that I may be sanctified in the midst of the Israelite people—I the LORD who sanctify you,
content_old: 32 You shall not profane My holy name, that I may be sanctified in the midst of the Israelite people—I the LORD who sanctify you,

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: These are My fixed times, the fixed times of the LORD, which you shall proclaim as sacred occasions.
content_old: 2 Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: These are My fixed times, the fixed times of the LORD, which you shall proclaim as sacred occasions.

content: 3 On six days work may be done, but on the seventh day there shall be a sabbath of complete rest, a sacred occasion. You shall do no work; it shall be a sabbath of the LORD throughout your settlements.
content_old: 3 On six days work may be done, but on the seventh day there shall be a sabbath of complete rest, a sacred occasion. You shall do no work; it shall be a sabbath of the LORD throughout your settlements.

content: 4 These are the set times of the LORD, the sacred occasions, which you shall celebrate each at its appointed time:
content_old: 4 These are the set times of the LORD, the sacred occasions, which you shall celebrate each at its appointed time:

content: 5 In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at twilight, there shall be a passover offering to the LORD,
content_old: 5 In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at twilight, there shall be a passover offering to the LORD,

content: 6 and on the fifteenth day of that month the LORD’s Feast of Unleavened Bread. You shall eat unleavened bread for seven days.
content_old: 6 and on the fifteenth day of that month the LORD’s Feast of Unleavened Bread. You shall eat unleavened bread for seven days.

content: 7 On the first day you shall celebrate a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations.
content_old: 7 On the first day you shall celebrate a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations.

content: 8 Seven days you shall make offerings by fire to the LORD. The seventh day shall be a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations.
content_old: 8 Seven days you shall make offerings by fire to the LORD. The seventh day shall be a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations.

content: 9 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 9 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 10 Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When you enter the land that I am giving to you and you reap its harvest, you shall bring the first sheaf of your harvest to the priest.
content_old: 10 Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When you enter the land that I am giving to you and you reap its harvest, you shall bring the first sheaf of your harvest to the priest.

content: 11 He shall elevate the sheaf before the LORD for acceptance in your behalf; the priest shall elevate it on the day after the sabbath.
content_old: 11 He shall elevate the sheaf before the LORD for acceptance in your behalf; the priest shall elevate it on the day after the sabbath.

content: 12 On the day that you elevate the sheaf, you shall offer as a burnt offering to the LORD a lamb of the first year without blemish.
content_old: 12 On the day that you elevate the sheaf, you shall offer as a burnt offering to the LORD a lamb of the first year without blemish.

content: 13 The meal offering with it shall be two-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD; and the libation with it shall be of wine, a quarter of a hin.
content_old: 13 The meal offering with it shall be two-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD; and the libation with it shall be of wine, a quarter of a hin.

content: 14 Until that very day, until you have brought the offering of your God, you shall eat no bread or parched grain or fresh ears; it is a law for all time throughout the ages in all your settlements.
content_old: 14 Until that very day, until you have brought the offering of your God, you shall eat no bread or parched grain or fresh ears; it is a law for all time throughout the ages in all your settlements.

content: 15 And from the day on which you bring the sheaf of elevation offering—the day after the sabbath—you shall count off seven weeks. They must be complete:
content_old: 15 And from the day on which you bring the sheaf of elevation offering—the day after the sabbath—you shall count off seven weeks. They must be complete:

content: 16 you must count until the day after the seventh week—fifty days; then you shall bring an offering of new grain to the LORD.
content_old: 16 you must count until the day after the seventh week—fifty days; then you shall bring an offering of new grain to the LORD.

content: 17 You shall bring from your settlements two loaves of bread as an elevation offering; each shall be made of two-tenths of a measure of choice flour, baked after leavening, as first fruits to the LORD.
content_old: 17 You shall bring from your settlements two loaves of bread as an elevation offering; each shall be made of two-tenths of a measure of choice flour, baked after leavening, as first fruits to the LORD.

content: 18 With the bread you shall present, as burnt offerings to the LORD, seven yearling lambs without blemish, one bull of the herd, and two rams, with their meal offerings and libations, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD.
content_old: 18 With the bread you shall present, as burnt offerings to the LORD, seven yearling lambs without blemish, one bull of the herd, and two rams, with their meal offerings and libations, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD.

content: 19 You shall also offer one he-goat as a sin offering and two yearling lambs as a sacrifice of well-being.
content_old: 19 You shall also offer one he-goat as a sin offering and two yearling lambs as a sacrifice of well-being.

content: 20 The priest shall elevate these—the two lambs—together with the bread of first fruits as an elevation offering before the LORD; they shall be holy to the LORD, for the priest.
content_old: 20 The priest shall elevate these—the two lambs—together with the bread of first fruits as an elevation offering before the LORD; they shall be holy to the LORD, for the priest.

content: 21 On that same day you shall hold a celebration; it shall be a sacred occasion for you; you shall not work at your occupations. This is a law for all time in all your settlements, throughout the ages.
content_old: 21 On that same day you shall hold a celebration; it shall be a sacred occasion for you; you shall not work at your occupations. This is a law for all time in all your settlements, throughout the ages.

content: 22 And when you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not reap all the way to the edges of your field, or gather the gleanings of your harvest; you shall leave them for the poor and the stranger: I the LORD am your God.
content_old: 22 And when you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not reap all the way to the edges of your field, or gather the gleanings of your harvest; you shall leave them for the poor and the stranger: I the LORD am your God.

content: 23 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 23 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 24 Speak to the Israelite people thus: In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you shall observe complete rest, a sacred occasion commemorated with loud blasts.
content_old: 24 Speak to the Israelite people thus: In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you shall observe complete rest, a sacred occasion commemorated with loud blasts.

content: 25 You shall not work at your occupations; and you shall bring an offering by fire to the LORD.
content_old: 25 You shall not work at your occupations; and you shall bring an offering by fire to the LORD.

content: 26 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 26 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 27 Mark, the tenth day of this seventh month is the Day of Atonement. It shall be a sacred occasion for you: you shall practice self-denial, and you shall bring an offering by fire to the LORD;
content_old: 27 Mark, the tenth day of this seventh month is the Day of Atonement. It shall be a sacred occasion for you: you shall practice self-denial, and you shall bring an offering by fire to the LORD;

content: 28 you shall do no work throughout that day. For it is a Day of Atonement, on which expiation is made on your behalf before the LORD your God.
content_old: 28 you shall do no work throughout that day. For it is a Day of Atonement, on which expiation is made on your behalf before the LORD your God.

content: 29 Indeed, any person who does not practice self-denial throughout that day shall be cut off from his kin;
content_old: 29 Indeed, any person who does not practice self-denial throughout that day shall be cut off from his kin;

content: 30 and whoever does any work throughout that day, I will cause that person to perish from among his people.
content_old: 30 and whoever does any work throughout that day, I will cause that person to perish from among his people.

content: 31 Do no work whatever; it is a law for all time, throughout the ages in all your settlements.
content_old: 31 Do no work whatever; it is a law for all time, throughout the ages in all your settlements.

content: 32 It shall be a sabbath of complete rest for you, and you shall practice self-denial; on the ninth day of the month at evening, from evening to evening, you shall observe this your sabbath.
content_old: 32 It shall be a sabbath of complete rest for you, and you shall practice self-denial; on the ninth day of the month at evening, from evening to evening, you shall observe this your sabbath.

content: 33 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 33 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 34 Say to the Israelite people: On the fifteenth day of this seventh month there shall be the Feast of Booths to the LORD,to last seven days.
content_old: 34 Say to the Israelite people: On the fifteenth day of this seventh month there shall be the Feast of Booths to the LORD,to last seven days.

content: 35 The first day shall be a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations;
content_old: 35 The first day shall be a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations;

content: 36 seven days you shall bring offerings by fire to the LORD. On the eighth day you shall observe a sacred occasion and bring an offering by fire to the LORD; it is a solemn gathering: you shall not work at your occupations.
content_old: 36 seven days you shall bring offerings by fire to the LORD. On the eighth day you shall observe a sacred occasion and bring an offering by fire to the LORD; it is a solemn gathering: you shall not work at your occupations.

content: 37 Those are the set times of the LORD that you shall celebrate as sacred occasions, bringing offerings by fire to the LORD—burnt offerings, meal offerings, sacrifices, and libations, on each day what is proper to it—
content_old: 37 Those are the set times of the LORD that you shall celebrate as sacred occasions, bringing offerings by fire to the LORD—burnt offerings, meal offerings, sacrifices, and libations, on each day what is proper to it—

content: 38 apart from the sabbaths of the LORD, and apart from your gifts and from all your votive offerings and from all your freewill offerings that you give to the LORD.
content_old: 38 apart from the sabbaths of the LORD, and apart from your gifts and from all your votive offerings and from all your freewill offerings that you give to the LORD.

content: 39 Mark, on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you have gathered in the yield of your land, you shall observe the festival of the LORDto last seven days: a complete rest on the first day, and a complete rest on the eighth day.
content_old: 39 Mark, on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you have gathered in the yield of your land, you shall observe the festival of the LORDto last seven days: a complete rest on the first day, and a complete rest on the eighth day.

content: 40 On the first day you shall take the product of hadar trees, branches of palm trees, boughs of leafy trees, and willows of the brook, and you shall rejoice before the LORD your God seven days.
content_old: 40 On the first day you shall take the product of hadar trees, branches of palm trees, boughs of leafy trees, and willows of the brook, and you shall rejoice before the LORD your God seven days.

content: 41 You shall observe it as a festival of the LORD for seven days in the year; you shall observe it in the seventh month as a law for all time, throughout the ages.
content_old: 41 You shall observe it as a festival of the LORD for seven days in the year; you shall observe it in the seventh month as a law for all time, throughout the ages.

content: 42 You shall live in booths seven days; all citizens in Israel shall live in booths,
content_old: 42 You shall live in booths seven days; all citizens in Israel shall live in booths,

content: 43 in order that future generations may know that I made the Israelite people live in booths when I brought them out of the land of Egypt, I the LORD your God.
content_old: 43 in order that future generations may know that I made the Israelite people live in booths when I brought them out of the land of Egypt, I the LORD your God.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 Command the Israelite people to bring you clear oil of beaten olives for lighting, for kindling lamps regularly.
content_old: 2 Command the Israelite people to bring you clear oil of beaten olives for lighting, for kindling lamps regularly.

content: 3 Aaron shall set them up in the Tent of Meeting outside the curtain of the Pact to burnfrom evening to morning before the LORD regularly; it is a law for all time throughout the ages.
content_old: 3 Aaron shall set them up in the Tent of Meeting outside the curtain of the Pact to burnfrom evening to morning before the LORD regularly; it is a law for all time throughout the ages.

content: 4 He shall set up the lamps on the pure lampstand before the LORD regularly.
content_old: 4 He shall set up the lamps on the pure lampstand before the LORD regularly.

content: 5 You shall take choice flour and bake of it twelve loaves, two-tenths of a measure for each loaf.
content_old: 5 You shall take choice flour and bake of it twelve loaves, two-tenths of a measure for each loaf.

content: 6 Place them on the pure table before the LORD in two rows, six to a row.
content_old: 6 Place them on the pure table before the LORD in two rows, six to a row.

content: 7 With each row you shall place pure frankincense, which is to be a token offering for the bread, as an offering by fire to the LORD.
content_old: 7 With each row you shall place pure frankincense, which is to be a token offering for the bread, as an offering by fire to the LORD.

content: 8 He shall arrange them before the LORD regularly every sabbath day—it is a commitment for all time on the part of the Israelites.
content_old: 8 He shall arrange them before the LORD regularly every sabbath day—it is a commitment for all time on the part of the Israelites.

content: 9 They shall belong to Aaron and his sons, who shall eat them in the sacred precinct; for they are his as most holy things from the LORD’s offerings by fire, a due for all time.
content_old: 9 They shall belong to Aaron and his sons, who shall eat them in the sacred precinct; for they are his as most holy things from the LORD’s offerings by fire, a due for all time.

content: 10 There came out among the Israelites one whose mother was Israelite and whose father was Egyptian. And a fight broke out in the camp between that half-Israelite and a certain Israelite.
content_old: 10 There came out among the Israelites one whose mother was Israelite and whose father was Egyptian. And a fight broke out in the camp between that half-Israelite and a certain Israelite.

content: 11 The son of the Israelite woman pronounced the Name in blasphemy, and he was brought to Moses—now his mother’s name was Shelomith daughter of Dibri of the tribe of Dan—
content_old: 11 The son of the Israelite woman pronounced the Name in blasphemy, and he was brought to Moses—now his mother’s name was Shelomith daughter of Dibri of the tribe of Dan—

content: 12 and he was placed in custody, until the decision of the LORD should be made clear to them.
content_old: 12 and he was placed in custody, until the decision of the LORD should be made clear to them.

content: 13 And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 13 And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 14 Take the blasphemer outside the camp; and let all who were within hearing lay their hands upon his head, and let the whole community stone him.
content_old: 14 Take the blasphemer outside the camp; and let all who were within hearing lay their hands upon his head, and let the whole community stone him.

content: 15 And to the Israelite people speak thus: Anyone who blasphemes his God shall bear his guilt;
content_old: 15 And to the Israelite people speak thus: Anyone who blasphemes his God shall bear his guilt;

content: 16 if he also pronounces the name LORD, he shall be put to death. The whole community shall stone him; stranger or citizen, if he has thus pronounced the Name, he shall be put to death.
content_old: 16 if he also pronounces the name LORD, he shall be put to death. The whole community shall stone him; stranger or citizen, if he has thus pronounced the Name, he shall be put to death.

content: 17 If anyone kills any human being, he shall be put to death.
content_old: 17 If anyone kills any human being, he shall be put to death.

content: 18 One who kills a beast shall make restitution for it: life for life.
content_old: 18 One who kills a beast shall make restitution for it: life for life.

content: 19 If anyone maims his fellow, as he has done so shall it be done to him:
content_old: 19 If anyone maims his fellow, as he has done so shall it be done to him:

content: 20 fracture for fracture, eye for eye, tooth for tooth. The injury he inflicted on another shall be inflicted on him.
content_old: 20 fracture for fracture, eye for eye, tooth for tooth. The injury he inflicted on another shall be inflicted on him.

content: 21 One who kills a beast shall make restitution for it; but one who kills a human being shall be put to death.
content_old: 21 One who kills a beast shall make restitution for it; but one who kills a human being shall be put to death.

content: 22 You shall have one standard for stranger and citizen alike: for I the LORD am your God.
content_old: 22 You shall have one standard for stranger and citizen alike: for I the LORD am your God.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses on Mount Sinai:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses on Mount Sinai:

content: 2 Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When you enter the land that I assign to you, the land shall observe a sabbath of the LORD.
content_old: 2 Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When you enter the land that I assign to you, the land shall observe a sabbath of the LORD.

content: 3 Six years you may sow your field and six years you may prune your vineyard and gather in the yield.
content_old: 3 Six years you may sow your field and six years you may prune your vineyard and gather in the yield.

content: 4 But in the seventh year the land shall have a sabbath of complete rest, a sabbath of the LORD: you shall not sow your field or prune your vineyard.
content_old: 4 But in the seventh year the land shall have a sabbath of complete rest, a sabbath of the LORD: you shall not sow your field or prune your vineyard.

content: 5 You shall not reap the aftergrowth of your harvest or gather the grapes of your untrimmed vines; it shall be a year of complete rest for the land.
content_old: 5 You shall not reap the aftergrowth of your harvest or gather the grapes of your untrimmed vines; it shall be a year of complete rest for the land.

content: 6 But you may eat whatever the land during its sabbath will produce—you, your male and female slaves, the hired and bound laborers who live with you,
content_old: 6 But you may eat whatever the land during its sabbath will produce—you, your male and female slaves, the hired and bound laborers who live with you,

content: 7 and your cattle and the beasts in your land may eat all its yield.
content_old: 7 and your cattle and the beasts in your land may eat all its yield.

content: 8 You shall count off seven weeks of years—seven times seven years—so that the period of seven weeks of years gives you a total of forty-nine years.
content_old: 8 You shall count off seven weeks of years—seven times seven years—so that the period of seven weeks of years gives you a total of forty-nine years.

content: 9 Then you shall sound the horn loud; in the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month—the Day of Atonement—you shall have the horn sounded throughout your land
content_old: 9 Then you shall sound the horn loud; in the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month—the Day of Atonement—you shall have the horn sounded throughout your land

content: 10 and you shall hallow the fiftieth year. You shall proclaim release throughout the land for all its inhabitants. It shall be a jubilee for you: each of you shall return to his holding and each of you shall return to his family.
content_old: 10 and you shall hallow the fiftieth year. You shall proclaim release throughout the land for all its inhabitants. It shall be a jubilee for you: each of you shall return to his holding and each of you shall return to his family.

content: 11 That fiftieth year shall be a jubilee for you: you shall not sow, neither shall you reap the aftergrowth or harvest the untrimmed vines,
content_old: 11 That fiftieth year shall be a jubilee for you: you shall not sow, neither shall you reap the aftergrowth or harvest the untrimmed vines,

content: 12 for it is a jubilee. It shall be holy to you: you may only eat the growth direct from the field.
content_old: 12 for it is a jubilee. It shall be holy to you: you may only eat the growth direct from the field.

content: 13 In this year of jubilee, each of you shall return to his holding.
content_old: 13 In this year of jubilee, each of you shall return to his holding.

content: 14 When you sell property to your neighbor, or buy any from your neighbor, you shall not wrong one another.
content_old: 14 When you sell property to your neighbor, or buy any from your neighbor, you shall not wrong one another.

content: 15 In buying from your neighbor, you shall deduct only for the number of years since the jubilee; and in selling to you, he shall charge you only for the remaining crop years:
content_old: 15 In buying from your neighbor, you shall deduct only for the number of years since the jubilee; and in selling to you, he shall charge you only for the remaining crop years:

content: 16 the more such years, the higher the price you pay; the fewer such years, the lower the price; for what he is selling you is a number of harvests.
content_old: 16 the more such years, the higher the price you pay; the fewer such years, the lower the price; for what he is selling you is a number of harvests.

content: 17 Do not wrong one another, but fear your God; for I the LORD am your God.
content_old: 17 Do not wrong one another, but fear your God; for I the LORD am your God.

content: 18 You shall observe My laws and faithfully keep My rules, that you may live upon the land in security;
content_old: 18 You shall observe My laws and faithfully keep My rules, that you may live upon the land in security;

content: 19 the land shall yield its fruit and you shall eat your fill, and you shall live upon it in security.
content_old: 19 the land shall yield its fruit and you shall eat your fill, and you shall live upon it in security.

content: 20 And should you ask, “What are we to eat in the seventh year, if we may neither sow nor gather in our crops?”
content_old: 20 And should you ask, “What are we to eat in the seventh year, if we may neither sow nor gather in our crops?”

content: 21 I will ordain My blessing for you in the sixth year, so that it shall yield a crop sufficient for three years.
content_old: 21 I will ordain My blessing for you in the sixth year, so that it shall yield a crop sufficient for three years.

content: 22 When you sow in the eighth year, you will still be eating old grain of that crop; you will be eating the old until the ninth year, until its crops come in.
content_old: 22 When you sow in the eighth year, you will still be eating old grain of that crop; you will be eating the old until the ninth year, until its crops come in.

content: 23 But the land must not be sold beyond reclaim, for the land is Mine; you are but strangers resident with Me.
content_old: 23 But the land must not be sold beyond reclaim, for the land is Mine; you are but strangers resident with Me.

content: 24 Throughout the land that you hold, you must provide for the redemption of the land.
content_old: 24 Throughout the land that you hold, you must provide for the redemption of the land.

content: 25 If your kinsman is in straits and has to sell part of his holding, his nearest redeemer shall come and redeem what his kinsman has sold.
content_old: 25 If your kinsman is in straits and has to sell part of his holding, his nearest redeemer shall come and redeem what his kinsman has sold.

content: 26 If a man has no one to redeem for him, but prospers and acquires enough to redeem with,
content_old: 26 If a man has no one to redeem for him, but prospers and acquires enough to redeem with,

content: 27 he shall compute the years since its sale, refund the difference to the man to whom he sold it, and return to his holding.
content_old: 27 he shall compute the years since its sale, refund the difference to the man to whom he sold it, and return to his holding.

content: 28 If he lacks sufficient means to recover it, what he sold shall remain with the purchaser until the jubilee; in the jubilee year it shall be released, and he shall return to his holding.
content_old: 28 If he lacks sufficient means to recover it, what he sold shall remain with the purchaser until the jubilee; in the jubilee year it shall be released, and he shall return to his holding.

content: 29 If a man sells a dwelling house in a walled city, it may be redeemed until a year has elapsed since its sale; the redemption period shall be a year.
content_old: 29 If a man sells a dwelling house in a walled city, it may be redeemed until a year has elapsed since its sale; the redemption period shall be a year.

content: 30 If it is not redeemed before a full year has elapsed, the house in the walled city shall pass to the purchaser beyond reclaim throughout the ages; it shall not be released in the jubilee.
content_old: 30 If it is not redeemed before a full year has elapsed, the house in the walled city shall pass to the purchaser beyond reclaim throughout the ages; it shall not be released in the jubilee.

content: 31 But houses in villages that have no encircling walls shall be classed as open country: they may be redeemed, and they shall be released through the jubilee.
content_old: 31 But houses in villages that have no encircling walls shall be classed as open country: they may be redeemed, and they shall be released through the jubilee.

content: 32 As for the cities of the Levites, the houses in the cities they hold—the Levites shall forever have the right of redemption.
content_old: 32 As for the cities of the Levites, the houses in the cities they hold—the Levites shall forever have the right of redemption.

content: 33 Such property as may be redeemed from the Levites—houses sold in a city they hold—shall be released through the jubilee; for the houses in the cities of the Levites are their holding among the Israelites.
content_old: 33 Such property as may be redeemed from the Levites—houses sold in a city they hold—shall be released through the jubilee; for the houses in the cities of the Levites are their holding among the Israelites.

content: 34 But the unenclosed land about their cities cannot be sold, for that is their holding for all time.
content_old: 34 But the unenclosed land about their cities cannot be sold, for that is their holding for all time.

content: 35 If your kinsman, being in straits, comes under your authority, and you hold him as though a resident alien, let him live by your side:
content_old: 35 If your kinsman, being in straits, comes under your authority, and you hold him as though a resident alien, let him live by your side:

content: 36 do not exact from him advance or accrued interest, but fear your God. Let him live by your side as your kinsman.
content_old: 36 do not exact from him advance or accrued interest, but fear your God. Let him live by your side as your kinsman.

content: 37 Do not lend him your money at advance interest, or give him your food at accrued interest.
content_old: 37 Do not lend him your money at advance interest, or give him your food at accrued interest.

content: 38 I the LORD am your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to give you the land of Canaan, to be your God.
content_old: 38 I the LORD am your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to give you the land of Canaan, to be your God.

content: 39 If your kinsman under you continues in straits and must give himself over to you, do not subject him to the treatment of a slave.
content_old: 39 If your kinsman under you continues in straits and must give himself over to you, do not subject him to the treatment of a slave.

content: 40 He shall remain with you as a hired or bound laborer; he shall serve with you only until the jubilee year.
content_old: 40 He shall remain with you as a hired or bound laborer; he shall serve with you only until the jubilee year.

content: 41 Then he and his children with him shall be free of your authority; he shall go back to his family and return to his ancestral holding.—
content_old: 41 Then he and his children with him shall be free of your authority; he shall go back to his family and return to his ancestral holding.—

content: 42 For they are My servants, whom I freed from the land of Egypt; they may not give themselves over into servitude.—
content_old: 42 For they are My servants, whom I freed from the land of Egypt; they may not give themselves over into servitude.—

content: 43 You shall not rule over him ruthlessly; you shall fear your God.
content_old: 43 You shall not rule over him ruthlessly; you shall fear your God.

content: 44 Such male and female slaves as you may have—it is from the nations round about you that you may acquire male and female slaves.
content_old: 44 Such male and female slaves as you may have—it is from the nations round about you that you may acquire male and female slaves.

content: 45 You may also buy them from among the children of aliens resident among you, or from their families that are among you, whom they begot in your land. These shall become your property:
content_old: 45 You may also buy them from among the children of aliens resident among you, or from their families that are among you, whom they begot in your land. These shall become your property:

content: 46 you may keep them as a possession for your children after you, for them to inherit as property for all time. Such you may treat as slaves. But as for your Israelite kinsmen, no one shall rule ruthlessly over the other.
content_old: 46 you may keep them as a possession for your children after you, for them to inherit as property for all time. Such you may treat as slaves. But as for your Israelite kinsmen, no one shall rule ruthlessly over the other.

content: 47 If a resident alien among you has prospered, and your kinsman being in straits, comes under his authority and gives himself over to the resident alien among you, or to an offshoot of an alien’s family,
content_old: 47 If a resident alien among you has prospered, and your kinsman being in straits, comes under his authority and gives himself over to the resident alien among you, or to an offshoot of an alien’s family,

content: 48 he shall have the right of redemption even after he has given himself over. One of his kinsmen shall redeem him,
content_old: 48 he shall have the right of redemption even after he has given himself over. One of his kinsmen shall redeem him,

content: 49 or his uncle or his uncle’s son shall redeem him, or anyone of his family who is of his own flesh shall redeem him; or, if he prospers, he may redeem himself.
content_old: 49 or his uncle or his uncle’s son shall redeem him, or anyone of his family who is of his own flesh shall redeem him; or, if he prospers, he may redeem himself.

content: 50 He shall compute with his purchaser the total from the year he gave himself over to him until the jubilee year; the price of his sale shall be applied to the number of years, as though it were for a term as a hired laborer under the other’s authority.
content_old: 50 He shall compute with his purchaser the total from the year he gave himself over to him until the jubilee year; the price of his sale shall be applied to the number of years, as though it were for a term as a hired laborer under the other’s authority.

content: 51 If many years remain, he shall pay back for his redemption in proportion to his purchase price;
content_old: 51 If many years remain, he shall pay back for his redemption in proportion to his purchase price;

content: 52 and if few years remain until the jubilee year, he shall so compute: he shall make payment for his redemption according to the years involved.
content_old: 52 and if few years remain until the jubilee year, he shall so compute: he shall make payment for his redemption according to the years involved.

content: 53 He shall be under his authority as a laborer hired by the year; he shall not rule ruthlessly over him in your sight.
content_old: 53 He shall be under his authority as a laborer hired by the year; he shall not rule ruthlessly over him in your sight.

content: 54 If he has not been redeemed in any of those ways, he and his children with him shall go free in the jubilee year.
content_old: 54 If he has not been redeemed in any of those ways, he and his children with him shall go free in the jubilee year.

content: 1 You shall not make idols for yourselves, or set up for yourselves carved images or pillars, or place figured stones in your land to worship upon, for I the LORD am your God.
content_old: 1 You shall not make idols for yourselves, or set up for yourselves carved images or pillars, or place figured stones in your land to worship upon, for I the LORD am your God.

content: 2 You shall keep My sabbaths and venerate My sanctuary, Mine, the LORD’s.
content_old: 2 You shall keep My sabbaths and venerate My sanctuary, Mine, the LORD’s.

content: 3 If you follow My laws and faithfully observe My commandments,
content_old: 3 If you follow My laws and faithfully observe My commandments,

content: 4 I will grant your rains in their season, so that the earth shall yield its produce and the trees of the field their fruit.
content_old: 4 I will grant your rains in their season, so that the earth shall yield its produce and the trees of the field their fruit.

content: 5 Your threshing shall overtake the vintage, and your vintage shall overtake the sowing; you shall eat your fill of bread and dwell securely in your land.
content_old: 5 Your threshing shall overtake the vintage, and your vintage shall overtake the sowing; you shall eat your fill of bread and dwell securely in your land.

content: 6 I will grant peace in the land, and you shall lie down untroubled by anyone; I will give the land respite from vicious beasts, and no sword shall cross your land.
content_old: 6 I will grant peace in the land, and you shall lie down untroubled by anyone; I will give the land respite from vicious beasts, and no sword shall cross your land.

content: 7 You shall give chase to your enemies, and they shall fall before you by the sword.
content_old: 7 You shall give chase to your enemies, and they shall fall before you by the sword.

content: 8 Five of you shall give chase to a hundred, and a hundred of you shall give chase to ten thousand; your enemies shall fall before you by the sword.
content_old: 8 Five of you shall give chase to a hundred, and a hundred of you shall give chase to ten thousand; your enemies shall fall before you by the sword.

content: 9 I will look with favor upon you, and make you fertile and multiply you; and I will maintain My covenant with you.
content_old: 9 I will look with favor upon you, and make you fertile and multiply you; and I will maintain My covenant with you.

content: 10 You shall eat old grain long stored, and you shall have to clear out the old to make room for the new.
content_old: 10 You shall eat old grain long stored, and you shall have to clear out the old to make room for the new.

content: 11 I will establish My abode in your midst, and I will not spurn you.
content_old: 11 I will establish My abode in your midst, and I will not spurn you.

content: 12 I will be ever present in your midst: I will be your God, and you shall be My people.
content_old: 12 I will be ever present in your midst: I will be your God, and you shall be My people.

content: 13 I the LORD am your God who brought you out from the land of the Egyptians to be their slaves no more, who broke the bars of your yoke and made you walk erect.
content_old: 13 I the LORD am your God who brought you out from the land of the Egyptians to be their slaves no more, who broke the bars of your yoke and made you walk erect.

content: 14 But if you do not obey Me and do not observe all these commandments,
content_old: 14 But if you do not obey Me and do not observe all these commandments,

content: 15 if you reject My laws and spurn My rules, so that you do not observe all My commandments and you break My covenant,
content_old: 15 if you reject My laws and spurn My rules, so that you do not observe all My commandments and you break My covenant,

content: 16 I in turn will do this to you: I will wreak misery upon you—consumption and fever, which cause the eyes to pine and the body to languish; you shall sow your seed to no purpose, for your enemies shall eat it.
content_old: 16 I in turn will do this to you: I will wreak misery upon you—consumption and fever, which cause the eyes to pine and the body to languish; you shall sow your seed to no purpose, for your enemies shall eat it.

content: 17 I will set My face against you: you shall be routed by your enemies, and your foes shall dominate you. You shall flee though none pursues.
content_old: 17 I will set My face against you: you shall be routed by your enemies, and your foes shall dominate you. You shall flee though none pursues.

content: 18 And if, for all that, you do not obey Me, I will go on to discipline you sevenfold for your sins,
content_old: 18 And if, for all that, you do not obey Me, I will go on to discipline you sevenfold for your sins,

content: 19 and I will break your proud glory. I will make your skies like iron and your earth like copper,
content_old: 19 and I will break your proud glory. I will make your skies like iron and your earth like copper,

content: 20 so that your strength shall be spent to no purpose. Your land shall not yield its produce, nor shall the trees of the land yield their fruit.
content_old: 20 so that your strength shall be spent to no purpose. Your land shall not yield its produce, nor shall the trees of the land yield their fruit.

content: 21 And if you remain hostile toward Me and refuse to obey Me, I will go on smiting you sevenfold for your sins.
content_old: 21 And if you remain hostile toward Me and refuse to obey Me, I will go on smiting you sevenfold for your sins.

content: 22 I will loose wild beasts against you, and they shall bereave you of your children and wipe out your cattle. They shall decimate you, and your roads shall be deserted.
content_old: 22 I will loose wild beasts against you, and they shall bereave you of your children and wipe out your cattle. They shall decimate you, and your roads shall be deserted.

content: 23 And if these things fail to discipline you for Me, and you remain hostile to Me,
content_old: 23 And if these things fail to discipline you for Me, and you remain hostile to Me,

content: 24 I too will remain hostile to you: I in turn will smite you sevenfold for your sins.
content_old: 24 I too will remain hostile to you: I in turn will smite you sevenfold for your sins.

content: 25 I will bring a sword against you to wreak vengeance for the covenant; and if you withdraw into your cities, I will send pestilence among you, and you shall be delivered into enemy hands.
content_old: 25 I will bring a sword against you to wreak vengeance for the covenant; and if you withdraw into your cities, I will send pestilence among you, and you shall be delivered into enemy hands.

content: 26 When I break your staff of bread, ten women shall bake your bread in a single oven; they shall dole out your bread by weight, and though you eat, you shall not be satisfied.
content_old: 26 When I break your staff of bread, ten women shall bake your bread in a single oven; they shall dole out your bread by weight, and though you eat, you shall not be satisfied.

content: 27 But if, despite this, you disobey Me and remain hostile to Me,
content_old: 27 But if, despite this, you disobey Me and remain hostile to Me,

content: 28 I will act against you in wrathful hostility; I, for My part, will discipline you sevenfold for your sins.
content_old: 28 I will act against you in wrathful hostility; I, for My part, will discipline you sevenfold for your sins.

content: 29 You shall eat the flesh of your sons and the flesh of your daughters.
content_old: 29 You shall eat the flesh of your sons and the flesh of your daughters.

content: 30 I will destroy your cult places and cut down your incense stands, and I will heap your carcasses upon your lifeless fetishes. I will spurn you.
content_old: 30 I will destroy your cult places and cut down your incense stands, and I will heap your carcasses upon your lifeless fetishes. I will spurn you.

content: 31 I will lay your cities in ruin and make your sanctuaries desolate, and I will not savor your pleasing odors.
content_old: 31 I will lay your cities in ruin and make your sanctuaries desolate, and I will not savor your pleasing odors.

content: 32 I will make the land desolate, so that your enemies who settle in it shall be appalled by it.
content_old: 32 I will make the land desolate, so that your enemies who settle in it shall be appalled by it.

content: 33 And you I will scatter among the nations, and I will unsheath the sword against you. Your land shall become a desolation and your cities a ruin.
content_old: 33 And you I will scatter among the nations, and I will unsheath the sword against you. Your land shall become a desolation and your cities a ruin.

content: 34 Then shall the land make up for its sabbath years throughout the time that it is desolate and you are in the land of your enemies; then shall the land rest and make up for its sabbath years.
content_old: 34 Then shall the land make up for its sabbath years throughout the time that it is desolate and you are in the land of your enemies; then shall the land rest and make up for its sabbath years.

content: 35 Throughout the time that it is desolate, it shall observe the rest that it did not observe in your sabbath years while you were dwelling upon it.
content_old: 35 Throughout the time that it is desolate, it shall observe the rest that it did not observe in your sabbath years while you were dwelling upon it.

content: 36 As for those of you who survive, I will cast a faintness into their hearts in the land of their enemies. The sound of a driven leaf shall put them to flight. Fleeing as though from the sword, they shall fall though none pursues.
content_old: 36 As for those of you who survive, I will cast a faintness into their hearts in the land of their enemies. The sound of a driven leaf shall put them to flight. Fleeing as though from the sword, they shall fall though none pursues.

content: 37 With no one pursuing, they shall stumble over one another as before the sword. You shall not be able to stand your ground before your enemies,
